Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: alexandra9007
Reviews.Content: I think the location of this hotel is 5 stars, and the hotel itself is 3 stars, thus my 4 star rating. The location can't be beat! You are so close to the Aquarium and other Inner Harbor attractions. It is such a short walk to the heart of the area; we loved that. The hotel itself is just fine. There is nothing fancy about it, and really nothing wrong with it either. The rooms have updated furniture and features along the lines of IKEA. The room was spacious with high ceilings. We paid in advance for the breakfast. We would have preferred to eat elsewhere once we saw it. The pastries and bagels were stale. You can have an omelet made-to-order; I think I should have done that instead of trying other things. There are two restaurants on-site: McCormick & Schmicks and Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. Having never gone to McCormick and under the impression that it is fine dining, I made a reservation there for our anniversary dinner. The dinner was good, but the atmosphere was more casual than we had wanted for a special night. Clearly, this is no fault of Pier 5. I didn't do my homework. If you are going for a special occasion, you may want to go with Ruth's Chris over McCormick. I would stay here for the location only - at $340/night (Friday with breakfast following morning), I might compare other Inner Harbor hotels next time I want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NPlainfieldLiz
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. It is not only centrally located - it is beautiful and the staff is wonderful. We had so much fun arranging our trip with Bryce, the Harbor specialist who was very kind and knowledgeable. Friday's Crabby hour is so much fun on and so is the chocolate tower on Saturday. Kevin hosts both and is wonderful. We are a retired Army family and our entire family are world travelers and we can all honestly say this is one of our very favorite places and we are planning to return!

Reviews.Title: “A Quick Vacation”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location! It is within walking distance to many attractions. We were only there for 2 days so we didn't get to use all the hotel amenities, however, the hotel decor and the size of the room was excellent. We plan on going back to Baltimore and we will definitely stay at the Pier 5 Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation fun”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P
Reviews.Content: We went to the Inner Harbor for spring break with our 6 and 8 year old kids... this hotel was perfectly located and very accomodating. I stumbled on it while searching on line and read the other reviews. Have nothing but good things to add! Staff was great, very friendly and wonderful with the kids. My 6 year old daughter still talks about getting to cook during "crabby hour". :) We could see right into the aqurairum where the dolphins train - couldn't have been closer to everything we wanted to do. Fun trip!

Reviews.Title: “Your only choice for excellance!”
Reviews.Author: jfurman3
Reviews.Content: Everything here was fantastic! The room, location, front desk, etc............ This is my only choice when I stay in Inner Harbor! I am soooo happy we stayed at pier 5=)

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 - Ideal Location and Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Pier 5 Hotel and found the staff to be extremely accommodating and the location perfect for getting around Baltimore. Their free shuttle service and kind drivers, their valet pakiing attendants, and front desk staff all went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable. I would recommend the Pier 5 if you visit Baltimore. THis hotel is a vibrant hotel that their rooms are contemporary and very clean We have stayed at their sister hotel, The Inn At Henderson's Wharf and found that to be excellent as well. The Henderson has a quiet, relaxing cottage type feel---very nice if you want to a more quiet atmosphere that makes seem a bit further from the hustle and bustle of the city. You still have access to the same free shuttle service and excellent drivers there and the staff also goes above and beyond there as well. I would choose to stay at either hotel without a second thought. I've never, ever had such personalized, caring service at another hotel I've ever stayed at before. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: plm2010
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here while my little son was having tests at Johns Hopkins. There were a few little glitches with our room upon check in, but these were quickly handled by the staff. Everyone (front desk, maintenence, and valet) were really nice and the kids loved the crab hats they received at Crabby Hour. You cannot beat the location, we had a balcony room that overlooked the aquarium. You could walk to many restaurants and of course the aquarium in less than 5 minutes. The only negative was there was fairly loud music coming from the lobby until after midnight. All of the rooms open onto the lobby so I did wonder why the music was on so loud for so long on a weeknight. However I could tolerate it so I never called the front desk and complained. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine N
Reviews.Content: The location of Pier 5 is outstanding--right in the middle of the inner harbor, and walkable to all kinds of shops and nearby neighborhoods. The view from the room was fantastic. The room was clean, fairly large, though a little dark. There was a cute little painting on the wall of the bathroom, but otherwise the decorations were what you would find in a standard chain motel. The overnight parking was quite expensive over $20 and gym and internet was extra as well. With a few small improvements the hotel could go from ok to great.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: csmfowler
Reviews.Content: The good: 1)Great location if you want waterfront and close to city attractions. 2) Hotel staff in most cases very nice and helpful especially Kevin on the night shift. 3) The Hotel was very nicely decorated or I might say very interestingly decorated, and 4) Had two high-end restraurants on site which was nice. The bad: 1) Was not really aware of the so called daily "destination charge" of $9.95 prior to check-in. This was for amenities that you receive for NO Charge at most other Hotels. Felt like my pocket book was being picked. 2) We arrived early, 11:00 AM and knew that check-in was afternoon, however was told by front desk that room was ready and empty but we had to pay a $20.00 early check-in fee. Another pocket book picking. 3) Informed front desk day prior to leaving that we needed a car for transportation to airport. Next morning they had failed to arrange a car and took cab 20 min to arrive. Front desk didn't seem to concerned that we might miss our flight, and 4) Rooms needed some refurbishing, showing age. Overall you might say the "bad" were just minor things and nothing is perfect and I agree. But you expect exceptional value and service when you pay the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very overpriced, but great staff and wonderful breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: albgardis
Reviews.Content: I had first learned about this hotel from Groupon, but they had offered only a 2-night-stay (which we can never take), so I had to let that go. But when Sniqueaway came out with an offer to stay for one night, I grabbed it! The pictures online of the building looked great, directly at the waterfront in the inner harbour of Baltimore. We arrove on a Wedneday afternoon and were greeted very nicely by Kyle (I believe) at the front desk. We checked in without any issues, were even handed a 25 $ voucher towards breakfast for the next morning! That had not been mentioned by Sniqueaway, so that was a nice surprise! We had booked a room for 199 $ with a king bed and harbour view. Now we did have a view into the harbour - when we looked out to the right over the lower roofs beneath our 3rd floor window. And we had a king bed as announced. But it was really only a very small standard room. The ceiling was constructed very interestingly (see pictures), it was going up high and looked very nice. But it only made the room bigger in an optical way, the ground size of the room stayed the same. On the door I had seen the floor map of the whole floor, and there I saw that our room (305) was like a handtowel (a small rectangular), and nearby were much bigger rooms. I would not say anything if we hadn't paid 199 $ for this. Usually I am paying less for a suite in a Kimpton hotel (by using deals)! And the 199 $ was a deal price by Sniqueaway! I looked up the rack rate online, and I saw the regular rate for our small room was 299 $ per night midweek. That is really too much!! And Hubby said he also found we have paid too much, even with that Snq coupon. At least we got that 25 $ voucher for breakfast, and that was really really great! We had the choice between a continental buffet (all you can eat) for 11.99 $ per person and a warm breakfast (eggs etc) for about 15 $ per person. We were standing in front of the buffet and the decision was easy, as it looked really wonderful. Pastries, breads, bagels, boiled eggs, fresh fruits and berries, joghurt, various juices, cereals, granola and much more that I am now forgetting. We really ate the money's worth to get ahead of the price, as we had paid too much for our small room. We were helped by Bill who was very friendly, just like all staff members we met. Kyle (front desk) had borrowed us an umbrella when we went out in the pouring rain for dinner the night before. Alexandra at the front desk helped me out with some key issues, and the maid gave me another bottle of (free) Voss water. The lobby was decorated very tastefully with beautiful furniture. I liked the open style, how you look down onto the lobby when you come out of your room. The architecture was really interesting in this building. But the bath room was unimpressive, I am afraid! Tub and shower combo, this American insult of a bathroom, I still can't believe this whenever I am seeing that. You can bathe 2 small children in that, but not an adult, and definitely not 2 adults. But even worse was the toilet design! Not only was the toilet right there by that joke of a tub, it also had the paper roll BEHIND the toilet at the wall. So you had to get yourself some paper rolled down and ripped before you sat down! In my age (48) I don't always have that time anymore, so even when you rush to the toilet and make it in time, then your spouse has to come in and get you some toilet paper fom the roll behind you. Or you stand up and drip into your underwear while you turn around and roll down some paper. Not good either way! The counter which held the ONE SINK was very big, and it could have easily held 2 sinks. I don't know why they did it like that, I thought that was wasted this way. There was also a hair dryer hanging in a bag from the bathroom door, also we had a safe in the closet plus a (tiny) robe (yes one robe, not two). We had free internet access, so we had brought our laptop along, which we have set up on the desk between the bed and the window. It worked fine. So I watched a german TV show online while Hubby watched some CCN news on the TV at the wall. Another nice thing was that the window actually opened! After the terrible rain on Wednesday night we awoke to a blue sky next morning with warm temperatures. It was March 1st and it felt like May 1st! We opened the window and enjoyed the fresh air. Glad that we could shut off the climate machine, because that was very loud. But at least it worked. I should also mention that they offer valet parking, but right before you get to the hotel you can self park in 2 various public places for $22 per 24 hours. I don't know what valet parking would have been, but I am sure it would have been more. Hubby loved the alarm clock, it looked just like the one I had in the early 70s, but besides ringing it could also say "Good Morning" when you shut it off. He would have bought that right away if that had been offered! There was a second clock standing in the shelf across the room, I think it was also a CD player. We haven't touched it, as we stayed only for one night, but it is a nice thing to have. I am sure this hotel has reallly nice rooms and suites, but considering our handtowel sized room was $ 299 ($199 with Snq), you can imagine you would pay the amount of your monthly mortgage payment for one night in a suite there. I have no idea why they believe these prices are adequate. I can get a Spa room or even a suite in a Kimpton hotel for less than this Pier 5 Hotel is asking for a very small standard room. Unless we can find an incredible deal for this hotel (and not just $100 off), we will stay at the Monaco (Kimpton) next time. I have actually already booked our 2 next Baltimore stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like VIPs”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Pier 5 the weekend of February 17th. We had an amazing time! First, the Monday before our arrival, Bryce called to offer his assistance in making reservations for dinner and/or events. I asked him if he could find out about a particular experience we were hoping to have, and he emailed the information to us very quickly. He was very knowledgeable and helpful. When we arrived on Friday, Wilson greeted us to provide valet service for our car. He was extremely friendly and also provided us with directions around the city. When we checked in, Empress immediately made us feel right at home. She was friendly and helpful and had an amazing attitude. Our room was nicely appointed and a good size. It was clean and comfortable. The Chocolate Event in the Lobby on Saturday was a nice distraction in the afternoon. We enjoyed the dipping and truffle-making! The gentleman behind the table there was very friendly, as well as was the gentleman who took our plates later on. I only wish I could remember everyone's names! My sister called down on Sunday morning to see if we could possibly get cookies for breakfast (yes, cookies for breakfast!), and the gentleman at the desk said that he would find out. When he called back he let us know that the cookies are not normally made in the morning, they are made fresh in the evening when most folks order them. However, he had asked the chef, and the chef agreed to make us fresh chocolate chip cookies. They were so delicious! Everyone we encountered at Pier 5 made us feel welcome and helped make our trip unforgettable. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time @ a great loaction...”
Reviews.Author: c w
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (and our 2 Beagles) just stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel for a two-day getaway using an incredible Groupon deal in Feb 2012. WOW, what an experience! The hotel was amazing, situated in the very heart of the Inner Harbor. The staff were incredible, epically Empress at the front desk. The chocolate fountain presentation was great...plus free cookies, fruits, and bottled water never hurts! MAC Fitness (which is free for all guests of the hotel) is one of the very best fitness clubs that I have ever attended. Everything is in walking distance; from the Inner Harbor, to the Power Plant, to Little Italy. Truly amazing! Plus your pets can stay w/ you at this awesome resort-type hotel w/ NO ADDITIONAL charge! Lastly, the Hotel Manager, Ted, is top notch and took sometime out of his busy day to give us a quick tour of the entire hotel…a great guy! Give'em your business, I'm sure that you will not be disappointed! And PLEASE, PLEASE Pier 5 Hotel, offer another reasonable Groupon sooner than later. We already want to come back...C. & D. W from Maryland 20904

Reviews.Title: “A-one treatment!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel in February for a short getaway weekend, had a wonderful time. The staff at the hotel went above and beyond to make us feel special, from Chef Kyle at the omelet station in the morning, to Bill who waited on us, and patiently listened to our 4 year old's important story! Empress, the one woman at the front desk, was again very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is in a prime location to anything you want to do in downtown Baltimore. If you need to go somewhere where you don't want to walk, they have shuttle service to take you there. They have a Chocolate demo hour on Saturdays, and that was truly great for a chocoholic like myself.(Champagne was included with the chocolate!) Our room was comfortable and homey, nice to relax after hoofing it all over the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: Linda21pro
Reviews.Content: The staff of Pier 5 is truly the greatest assest this hotel has. Terrance, Empress, Laura, and the valet and other staff were all incredible. Terrance was so sweet and made sure that I had the best deal possible. He gave advise on places to go and best deals. Empress (her name fits her personallity - truly beautiful) is so welcoming. She remembered my daughter and I from our visit almost a year ago. She made sure that everything went smoothly and was so much fun during the "chocolate hour!" The chocolate fondue was so large and fun. The tickets through their hotel for the Aquarium were VIP which allowed us access to Aquarium anytime and included all shows. Staying at this hotel makes you central to everything. We parked and walked every where. It was so great. We loved Little Italy and ate at Amicci's Very Casual Eatery. Food was great. Sangria had Amaretto in it - delicious. We walked to Fell's area and there were nice shops. We had a nice relaxing weekend by the water.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: 8788donna
Reviews.Content: The reason for the excellent rating is, truly, the service we received from everyone at the hotel. Granted, the room could have used a bit of updating, but my husband and I had two large rooms (sitting room with TV and bedroom with a very comfortable king-sized bed and TV. The bathroom was large and had tons of counter space. Everything was very clean. The large heating/cooling element was a bit of an eyesore and it was a little noisy. However, we both said we have never been treated so well as we were during our stay. I had some initial issues making a reservation, but a wonderful reservation specialist named Kristina McCooey took care of everything once she understand my issues. When we arrived at the hotel, our car and luggage was taken care of immediately, and we were warmly greeted at the front desk by Laura; her enthusiasm and friendliness were not something we typically experience at a hotel, and it started our trip on a very positive note. Throughout our stay, we encountered the same treatment -- our "crabby" host, Kevin; Empress, the day shift front desk person who, when she found out our breakfast order had not been picked up the night before, immediately told us to have the lobby buffet breakfast "on her"; Billy, who put a newspaper aside for us and set up a breakfast table for us; and several people who's names I neglected to get. The location of the hotel is fantastic for visits to the Harbor and Little Italy, and if you don't mind a bit of a walk, it's close enough to Fells Point as well. The Groupon deal we purchased included two nights, free drink coupons, $25 towards dinner, and a $25 gift card for a future stay. We can assure you that we'll be back (and we'll bring you cookies from Vaccaro's again!). Thanks for a great Baltimore experience!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive...”
Reviews.Author: kari h
Reviews.Content: Pier V Hotel will not only hold a special place in me and my husbands hearts because it's where we got married but because of how impressive the staff and hotel our in general. We went back to enjoy the hotel and all it has to offer over the weekend to celebrate an early Valentines. From the moment we were greeted by the valet until we were being checked out we couldn't have asked for anymore. The staff is incredibly friendly and approachable. The amenities like crabby hour and the chocolate event that occurs everyday is delicious and a great perk! The rooms are very spacious with great views of the harbor or of the city! It is located near many main attractions of the inner harbor while having 2 upscale restaurants on site! We never wanted to leave but are glad to know the Pier V hotel and its staff is always there waiting with light on whenever we need them!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but poor service”
Reviews.Author: GB_414
Reviews.Content: Because I was traveling for business a separate business account was used to pay for part of my stay, I had to make the reservation over the phone. When I arrived at the hotel, however, I was informed that I had to pay more than twice what I was quoted over the phone when I made the reservation. The woman at the front desk said that she'd look into it, but we never heard from anyone again. On check out, we brought this up again and were told it would be addressed. However, we were still changed more than twice the quoted amount. However, the hotel was very clean. The shuttle service, while limited in its destinations, was always on time and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon @ Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: TheSaent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at Pier 5 for our honeymoon. We were treated well and given quite a few coupons and perks upon check in. The room was fantastic, the hotel was very beautiful. I loved the location. I wasn't impressed with the restaurant, McCormick & Schmicks in the hotel, but besides that I have absolutely no complaints. The food service was quick, and good too!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Tired”
Reviews.Author: wakefantwo
Reviews.Content: "Tired" is the best descriptor of our stay at the Pier 5. It describes both the decor and our state when we left the hotel due to the ceaseless running of the heating unit. With some updating, this could be an outstanding hotel. The location is perfect--halfway between the Inner Harbor and Fell's Point. There are numerous great restaurants and activities within walking distance or via the free bus (Charm City Circulator). Also, the views of the harbor are nice. The lobby is a great place to sit with friends plus Crabby hour cant be beat. If you don't want to go out for breakfast, there is a reasonably priced buffet in the lobby. Parking is also reasonably priced for the area. Lastly, the staff are terrific. We hope that management will do some renos so that we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, personable staff, and unique "extras"”
Reviews.Author: HemingwayDakota
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience was pleasant. We too - similar to other reviewers, used a Groupon. Despite not paying full price, we were treated as any other customer and received all of the promised coupons for drinks and towards dinner. We attended the first night the "Crabby Friday", where a crepe making session was held. The 'chef' made the event enjoyable and his humor encouraged people to participate. We did not attend the Saturday Chocolate gathering, though we would have enjoyed this 'extra.' Our room was clean and comfortable. It faced the front of the hotel, and though part of the view was hampered as well by construction, looking to the side was a wonderful scenic view of the Harbor. Guests were given an opportunity to "Go Green" by choosing not to have the room made up, and we did take advantage of that option. My only two "negatives" were the fact that upon arrival on a Friday afternoon there was no doorman. As my husband unloaded the car, I had to find a luggage cart and manipulate the entrance. The cart was not that easy for me to push, but I needed to do so to clear the doorway. There was no valet parking person around either. It did not seem a very welcome way to enter the hotel. However, the front desk employees were exceptionally friendly, which made up for this first impression. My second 'negative' was the perfume scented spray used in both the rooms and the hallways. It was so overpowering that my eyes were watering. The front desk, with an apology, said that there were no rooms where this spray was not used by the maids. For this reason, the first night and through the next day we needed to keep the sliding glass door partially open to 'air' out the room. It was fine by the middle of the next day. Finally, the hotel is immediately next to the Aquarium and other locations which make the Harbor much fun for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “8 Friends Meeting Up In Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: traveltime61
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 Hotel is a great hotel. We were made to feel welcome from the time we pulled up in front of the hotel. The door man came to our truck asked if we needed help with anything and if we like valet parking or if we like to park ourselves. He even told us the prices. We choose to pay the $22.00 to park ourselves in the open lot by the hotel as we planned not to move it until we left. We approached the desk and were greeted by the friendiest guy in this business. He was social, very informative and friendly. I wish I could remember his name! We were using a Groupon Coupon and he made sure we got all the free drink tickets and the $25.00 off for dinner and the $25.00 off to come back to one of the Magic Harbor Hotels . He told us about their Crabby Fridays as well their Saturday Chocolate social gatherings and the shuttle bus. We sat in on the crabby crepe making session and drank a glass or two of free wine and a beer while waiting on friends. He was also the person that demo the crabby crepe that night. We stayed from Friday January 20 and checked out Sunday January 22, 2012. It snowed Friday night and we were out with friends at bars and clubs until 2. We had to walk back to the Hotel because every Cab that came by was Full. It was not a long walk and it was so beautiful with the fresh falling snow. Saturday we used the Shuttle to get around. It worked out great!! Our room was clean and large. We will be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but, stay away from Ruth the banquet manager!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Ruth the banquet manager is the worst person you can find there. I stayed there and I attended a dinner and was absolutely disrespected by Ruth. She was very rude and made gestures that I am stupid because I asked if the bar there was an open bar. Besides Ruth I had an awesome night almost derailed by Ruth but, the rooms and the location was awesome definitely will stay again but, not have a banquet party!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJJoyful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over MLK weekend, using a Snique Away deal. It was sooo cold that weekend, but our room was spacious and warm. Shower had great pressure, front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and they let us check in at noon, which was great! We took the water taxi to Fells Point, and while waiting for one to take us back (and freezing), the Harbormagic shuttle pulled right up to us and we hopped in. We arrived back just in time for the chocolate fountain event in the hotel lobby. This hotel is much pricier in the warm weather, and we probably would not pay that price, but the deal we had for our weekend was well worth it and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: cookwith5kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed last night in 2 rooms in the Pier 5 Hotel. The location of this hotel deserves 10 stars if I could. The room itself I would give 2 or 3. We needed two rooms since we were travelling with our 5 kids. We had requested adjoining rooms, but all of those were sold out. The best they could do was 2 rooms 10 doors away. I begged for 2 closer rooms and we were then given 2 rooms side by side. The room with a king bed and a pullout sofa was very large and spacious. The mattress on the pullout sofa had many stains and was VERY uncomfortable. My son who slept there did not enjoy it. The king mattress was great and this room had 2 tvs, NICE! The other room we had was 2 queens and those were both nice. Watch the heavy wooden headboards if you have little kids. We had a few headbumps on those. The decor is very nice. Our view out the window and sliding door was really sad. Considering the harbor is there, all we could see were 20 air conditioning units. Really bad. The best part of the trip was the Crabby Hour. It is free everyday from 5:30-6:30. We learned how they make crepes with a very cool crepe maker and each of us got to make our own. The kids loved the plain ones, the adults loved the artichoke/spinach stuffing. Free local Ravens beer and wine made it a perfect evening. The King suite had a nice thermostat on the wall that worked very well. The 2 queen bed room had a very noisy poorly working wall unit. One really strange thing, the counter in the bathroom seemed really short. I am average height and I was bending down to use it. My over 6 foot son looked ridiculous trying to brush his teeth and bending waaaay down to reach the water. Valet parking worked very well but we only parked and took the car out one time. Breakfast was one downfall. The food was not all setup when we came down. There were no plates, no knives, small problems. But all the baked goods, bagels, muffins, danish, toast, tasted like they were first served a week ago. Yes, they really tasted that stale. The one highlight was the fresh fruit. Really nicely cut and displayed and super sweet! Oatmeal, juices, a few yogurts, cold cereals and cottage cheese rounded out the rest of the buffet. The toaster worked great but took about 6 minutes to toast each thing. I can only imagine how crazy that is when a lot of people are all eating breakfast at the same time. There are many amazing wedding rooms in the hotel. What a great location for a wedding or event. All the staff members we interacted with were lovely and very helpful. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, sketchy execution”
Reviews.Author: delanor
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location, you can walk to restaurants, attractions, etc. But in a 2 day stay they botched twice and that's not good. The first one was my coming back in the evening to find that my room's door had been left open -- not latched or even fully closed -- by the staff. Lucky that nothing happened. The second gaffe was inexcusable -- they completely forgot the wake up call that I called in (not programmed in) from my room. The next morning I had a 9AM event downstairs in the meeting rooms, and next thing I know I'm waking up at 8:40. I was livid, they offered to forego some minor fees and a room service breakfast, but the whole reason I had come to this trip was now in jeopardy. Fastest shower/shave ever, I made it, but it really made a bad start to an important day. Friendly, helpful staff, and I'd give this hotel one more chance, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for our family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: kay z
Reviews.Content: Great location with extremely friendly service! We always bank on tripadvisor reviews to help us make choices on where to go, what to see, and how we will be treated as a guests. My family (5 adults & 1 child under 10), instead of giving gifts, travels to an exciting place each year and this year we decided on Baltimore. We found this Groupon for the Pier 5 Hotel and it was quite a snatch. The important stuff: -The rooms were clean and very spacious with flat screens. (Our one and only complaint was that the TV guide system they use to navigate through the channels is very slow and you can't just use the 'up and down' buttons on the remote to change the channel.) -We were surprised that the continental breakfast was included it was that good...healthy options, and the spread was beautiful. A waitstaff person was on hand to take plates and be of service if needed. Coffee was delicious. -Location: FABULOUS! This city is extremely walkable, and the hotel is positioned in a wonderful spot on the harbor: right in between all the local attractions (Aquarium, Power Plant Live!) and Little Italy/Fells Point. -The general manager of the hotel was very nice and also very knowledgable about the city, recommending some great places. -They do a "Crabby Hour" on the weekdays between 5:30-6:30, where they teach you how to make crab dip or crabby crepes and you can enjoy great local beer. They even have crab hats you can wear. Was a great experience for our 7 yr old. Overall, we had an amazing experience together as a family. The American Visionary Arts Museum is an ABSOLUTE must-see! The Aquarium is a no-brainer -- such interesting exhibits. And the shopping and dining at Fell's Point (just down a few blocks from the hotel) is amazing. Thanks for a great experience at your hotel! We'll DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Dan J
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Pier V for only one night and I'm still wishing that we were still there. We came in late, using the parking garage as opposed to the valet (only because I'm directionally challenged and found the parking garage first) and left not long after their wonderful continental breakfast so our experience was brief but memorable. Our room was beautiful and clean and our balcony was even pleasant despite the cold winter weather. We were greeted at the door by polite staff who welcomed us, offered to help with our bags, and showed us to the front desk, where once again we were greeted by wonderful folks who offered suggestions for our short stay in Baltimore. The following morning we enjoyed a quiet breakfast in the lobby where we again had delightful conversation with the hotel staff about local attractions and dining experiences. The folks helping with breakfast were very kind and pleasant despite being so busy catering to all of us (that selection was perfect by the way, and everything tasted great!). I was sad to check out, especially without personally thanking Bryce, our hotel magic specialist, who emailed me throughout the week prior to my stay about different options and ideas for our trip. We rarely visited Baltimore in the past, but after this experience we're both very much looking forward to our next stay at this wonderful hotel with all of the delightful staff. In fact, the baseball season will be starting soon and I have a feeling I'll be enjoying the Pier V accomodations a lot this season. My only regret is that I didn't get everyone's name before I left so that I could thank them in this review. Thank you again Pier V, I hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Satisfied Customer!”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: My husband and Ifirst came to the Pier 5 Hotel 3 years ago for our anniversary. We liked it so much we came back last weekend. It was even better than we remembered. The staff was so helpful and friendly. We were very pleased with everything from the valet to the cleanliness of the room. The front desk staff was awesome. I believe it was Kevin and Greg that helped when we checked in. The location to many great places to dine was a bonus for us. We went to the aquarium which was just across the pier from us. We also had a fantastic dinner at McCormick and Schmicks which was located right in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “City Life!”
Reviews.Author: MrsJvWife
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel with a beautiful view of downtown. Service was excellent and fast. The room was beautiful and warm. I loved the restaurant Ruth Chris'. The food was soooooo delicious and mouth-watering. I go to this restaurant just about every 2 weeks. This is a great place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Curt60
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 Hotel is perfectly situated between the Inner Harbor and Fells Point, just a short walk to each, but also just on the quieter side of either place. The rooms are very nice as others have mentioned. With Ruth Chris and McCormick and Schmicks in the same building, a great meal with a view of the harbor is only steps away. The staff was outstanding, genuinely friendly and helpful. The staff turned a very nice hotel experience into outstanding rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: productcomment
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night in December at the Pier 5 Hotel as part of a 2-day business meeting. This is located right on the Inner Harbor of Baltimore, 1 pier away from the National Aquarium. The hotel is very nice, clean, and a great location. We had a very reasonable group room rate so I don't know what they normally charge. The only drawback is that the layout is an open square from lobby to rooftop, so that all the room doors face the cavernous opening. This is ok unless there is a loud party or reception going on , as there was the night I was there. I didn't hear it since my room was far enough away, but others in our group complained about the late night noise. On the other hand, the view from my room of the Inner Harbor was nice. Internet connection was free with the room and worked fine. There are 2 high end dining options in the hotel but plenty of moderate price restaurants nearby, including Little Italy and and Fells Point several blocks away. The hotel offers a small continental breakfast for $9.95 or you can order something hot ($14.95) in a smallish breakfast area. They also offer a "Crabby Hour" starting at 5:30 with light snacks, wine, and beer complimentary -a nice touch. Parking rates are a bit steep (valet ($32/day) or park yourself ($22/day) in an open lot next to the hotel) but that's the trend for hotels in cities these days. Overall, a good experience, nice location, and comfortable stay. I definitely recommend it if you can get a good rate and find yourself in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: james e
Reviews.Content: Wife and I decided to get away one night for our anniversary. Stayed at Pier 5's highest rated room and in most case we were very impressed. The hotel employees were very friendly and Kevin at the front desk was very professional and will go out of his way to make your stay perfect. The view from our room was breathtaking. The suite was very nice but certainly could do with some updating when you factor in cost. Dont get us wrong the room itself was gorgeous just seemed a lil bit dated. All in all we would def. recommend this hotel and would go their ourselves again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rslev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of Thanksgiving, 2011. It's a very nice hotel. Nice decor, large room and very good location (right in the Inner Harbor). The staff was quite friendly and helpful. We really liked our stay here. They also offered free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel, which was fast and easy to access. I have no real complaints, though the buffet breakfast was a bit disappointing (slow service, though they apologized and comped us the meal, and the quality of the food is just OK - may do better to walk to Fell's Point and have brunch out). We didn't try room service, but the hotel is attached to 2 chain restaurants (Ruth's Chris Steak House and McCormick & Schmick's) so I'm sure it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dianna P
Reviews.Content: I need to travel to Baltimore for medical reasons and this hotel has a program for Johns Hopkins patients; you can obtain limo transportation to and from the hospital whenever you need it. I purchased this opyion and I was provided with my own personal assistant to arrange for whatever I needed before I arrived. This service was invaluable! The hotel is in a great location, next to the aquarium and I was able to purchase tickets to the aquarium before I arrived. The restaurant located within the hotel, McCormick & Schmick's Seafood Restaurant was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: 60HzMW
Reviews.Content: The Pier V Hotel in Baltimore is located right next to the National Aquarium and Hard Rock Cafe and a very short walk from Little Italy. The front desk staff were exceptional (I hope you have the chance to meet and chat with kevin) and greeted me with enthusiasm at 9:00 PM. I had a room on the third floor looking across the water toward the aquarium. I never turned the flatscreen TV on, but the high ceiling, lighting, king size bed, high speed internet, and slide-open window made for a nice stay. The purpose of my visit was business, and I can say the meeting facilities were nice and spacious. After the meetings, the hotel's location on the waterfront made taking evening walks and shoppiong a breeze. Two things kept me from rating this hotel a full five stars (call me picky if you like): there could be some more attention paid to the maintenance of the building and the food/ snacks for our meetings could have been better. With that said I would not hesitate to stay here again, and I would find this location exellent for families visiting the Inner harbor area. Perhaps most important to me- the room was absolutely quiet at night. I did not hear a single slamming door in three nights while trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Pier 5 hotel for a weekend getaway to Baltimore. The initial decision to stay at the hotel was primarily based on its proximity to the attractions we planned to attend. I had read the reviews on site and it seemed like a safe bet. Upon arrival, I will say that all of our expectations were greatly exceeded. We arrived early (1130am) and were promptly greeted by the incredibly friendly front desk staff. Though our room was not quite ready, (we were automatically upgraded as iPrefer members and would highly recommend signing up at their website) the staff held our luggage , arranged for our turn down service, and gave us our Aquarium tickets(if you intend to go to the Aquarium this hotel has the best overall package and price for any of the Inner Harbor hotels). We toured the Inner Harbor for about an hour or so when the front desk attendant called my wife's cell phone to let us know our room was ready. Once back at the hotel and seeing the room.....I was amazed at the quality of the hotel for the price we paid. The upgraded room we received was a two-room (living/bedroom) with three separate balconies providing an amazing panoramic of the Harbor. The room was clean well stocked and incredibly comfortable. The decor is different depending on what you prefer, we found it to be beautiful. I could go on about this hotel, but I can sum it up by saying that whenever my wife and I decide to vacation in Baltimore, there is no other hotel I will stay at (which typically we stay in Marriott, Hilton,Hyatt, etc during domestic travel). I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a trip to Baltimore's Inner Harbor. Thank you Pier 5 for an amazing experience

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Fay G
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend had her 40th JP party last night at Pier 5 Hotel. From the moment we got there untill we were leaving,OMG! The men who parked and return our cars, the ladies at the front dest, the rooms/bathrooms (very, very clean). OMG! The water view, Ah! I could go on and on. I would DENINITEY recommend this hotel. Thank you Pier 5 Hotel. My friends and I had the best time ever. Fay G

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, tons of perks AND family friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Lani M
Reviews.Content: My family visited Pier 5 last weekend and will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends and family when visiting Baltimore. The hotel itself is small, decorated in fun, modern colors, and is in a PRIME location right on the water and walking distance to pretty much everything. The beds are super comfortable, and the service cannot be beat! I'd like to personally thank Kevin, Rose, Mariah and Billy for sharing their "Can Do" attitude and amazing knowledge of all things Baltimore with us so we could have the best time possible. Be sure to check out their free Crabby Hour during the week and The Chocolate Event on Saturdays! Also, love that you can order milk and cookies, or a 1/2 bottle of wine for less than $10 and have it brought up to your room in about 10 minutes. I really have nothing but great things to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: 111stephanie111
Reviews.Content: Our son was just married and the reception was at the Pier Five Hotel in their upstairs Harbor overlook room. Not only was the staff very friendly and accommodating but the food was delicious. We were worried at how the room would look with the funky carpet but in the evening sun set it was stunning and you didn't pay attention to the carpet with the beautiful harbor view. We brought our on table decorations and they set everything up perfectly. Everyone complimented us on the room and the food. Forty of us spent the night and were all treated well.They honored our requests to be close and check in early. I was extremely pleased with every aspect of the hotel and how they take care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of a chain hotel with a unique touch!”
Reviews.Author: SamiKnight
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a 3rd party website, and got a great deal. The hotel was charming, and very unique. The rooms were really homey, with little extra touches that really set it apart from your standard chain hotel. Beautiful location down on the waterfront, would definitely recommend! Just one gripe, no onsite parking, had to pay in a lot adjacent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend at Pier 5. We were very disappointed. The hotel seemed tired--a bit dingy. Staff seemed distracted and not that helpful. Limited room service, stale pastry. Promised a pot of coffee--got a paper cup. Promised a "chocolate extravagana" got a tired looking chocolate fountain. Had to wait for bellman for so long, my husband went and got a cart himself. Not terribly kid friendly. On the plus side, the manager was kind enough to "comp" one night after he heard about our experience. Would still perferred to have had a fantastic time and paid the full price. Will not be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “So far this trip has been amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay P
Reviews.Content: The directions were easy to follow and check in was quick and painless. There was a wedding going on at the same but that did not slow down the check in staff.Rose was amazing and gave us all the information we needed to find a great place for dinner and a drink.She was courteous and knowledgeable. The hotel room is great and the location is convenient. Thanks Rose and Pier 5!

Reviews.Title: “Musty, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNYS
Reviews.Content: The good news is that the Pier 5 is very well located and has two good restaurants Ruth’s Chris Steak House and McCormick and Schmick’s as well as Pizzazz Tuscan Grille right there. The bad news is that our room was very musty and had a very noisy through the wall heating system. There is a construction site across the street and they started work early (even though it was Saturday). Would look for another hotel in Baltimore if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “4th Visit to the Pier 5 and it keeps getting better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie06
Reviews.Content: WOW....just returned home from the Pier 5. This was to celebrate my birthday. (We had reservations on 8/28 and the hurricane hit so we had to change the dates. Empress and Jill assisted us with the changes and understanding. Empress was there to greet us upon check in and welcomed us and the pup back...SHE IS WONDERFUL!!! Just the smile on her face and her sunshine made us immediately so happy to be back. MacKenzie, our Scottish Terrier, enjoyed her stay also. Both Jill and Empress surprised me with some nice goodies!! It was amazing!! Great room (we always ask for the same one!), great service from each and every employee. We enjoyed the reception at the Admiral Fell's Inn. MacKenzie was so relaxed and all the employees made us and her feel so welcome. So, I couldn't ask for anything more....Great getaway and great way to spend my birthday...THANK YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “A sheer pleasure”
Reviews.Author: NZarate
Reviews.Content: From front steps to check out, a sheer pleasure. The staff treated us like family. Extremely relaxing atmosphere. The room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holel with stunning views of the Harbor. Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: llchaney1
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderfull Hotel, The suit was clean and nice. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The hotel is within walking distance to everything, you won't have to move your car to go anywhere. The only complaint that I have is that the bed was very uncomfortable, but beyond that it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view --will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: rhedbird
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely all that it advertises. The room was quite comfortable. Very close to everything at the Inner Harbor. Enjoyed Crabby Hour--nice appetizer before dinner. Would definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Sugarb2124
Reviews.Content: Aside from some small issues such as; no free continental breakfast, no pool and poor tv channel selection, pretty accommodating. Very friendly staff and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Wonderful Amenities”
Reviews.Author: KathyCollegeville
Reviews.Content: The service and staff was amazing. Our Hotel Specialist took care of getting VIP tickets to the Baltimore Aquarium and American Visionary Musceum. Also, told us about discount dining vouchers, which we purchased and she even took care of making our reservations for dinner. Everything was waiting for us when we checked in. We loved how the hotel was decorated. Loved the size of our room and how it was furnished. Very modern and artsy. Nice view of the harbor/pier. Next time we will definately get a room with a balcony. The location is excellant. Walking distance of everything and what's too far we took the water taxi. We had a great time and would definately stay here again. Only negative is the air conditioner in the room is loud. The constant going off and on during the night was disruptive so we turned on high so it would just stay on.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was excellent, the staff and ammenities were the best! High recommendations!!!”
Reviews.Author: M_Z_1134227
Reviews.Content: Our trip was excellent. The hotel and staff were very helpful, polite, and friendley. It was a wonderful experiece for our son too and he cannot wait to return next summer. The Pier 5 is conveniently located right in the middle of Inner Harbor, restaurants, shops, the water front and within walking distance to the aquarium, museums, boats, several ship tours, and the health club. We used the free shuttle to provide transportation to John Hopkins and Fells Point for dinner. Their shuttle was always on call and promptly on time. The rooms are decorated nicely and the hotel has a business center that provided computers and printers. Crabby hour was fun and delicious. Thank you for a wonderful experience. We will return and recommend anyone planning a trip to Baltimore, stay at Pier 5.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly Stay that welcomed our Dog”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: We loved our weekend stay with our Golden/Lab Retriever mix dog. It was nice to have a pet friendly hotel that didn't charge extra fees that welcomed our family pet. The hotel is trendy and welcoming and we had a very nice time going to the wellness center for a quick dip at the indoor pool before we got ready for dinner. We loved our stay because we didn't have to worry about leaving our dog behind at home, could enjoy her for walks and still enjoy ourselves in Baltimore. I cannot wait to go back and am already trying to plan a visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic overall stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: The location was great, all of the staff were exceptionally helpful and freindly, decore of room and size was excellent and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Jlae
Reviews.Content: Went there for business, staff was amazing as usual. Hotel looks great and location is perfect. Highly recommended and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: This convenient location with it's accommodating staff made our weekend a memorable one. Clean and comfortable room that was well supplied. My only questions for all hotels is, "Why bother having LCD T.V.'s if you don't have High Definition channels?"

Reviews.Title: “One Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel46
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 5 stars on their first class staff! This was the best experience I have ever had. Prior to arriving several contacts were made to make sure we had everything we wanted. They told us all about the area. Perfect location right on the water. Hotel only has 66 rooms. 2 great restaurants! Valet parking was free to us. We paid $333 with all the taxes and extras for a Friday night which included a $50 restaurant gift card that only cost us $40 (optional to buy). Room was ample size with all the amenities you need. Free bottled water, robe, coffee pot, hair dryer, shampoo, iron/ironing board, hair conditioner, bar soap, room darkening blinds. Fresh live flowers. It was sort of nice that the room did not have a stocked mini bar because it is always an issue where a hotel charges for something you did not have. Air conditioner worked perfectly. Ice maker close by. We had a water view room with large balcony. Very nice! Hotel gave us a free gift certificate to one of their partner restaurants. Also 2 free cocktails included. I really can't find anything bad to say about this property. I can't give them a 5 star rating because I have stayed at 5 star properties before so I know what it takes to maintain this rating. I would not hesitate to return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel. Very great location for the Inner Harbor area.”
Reviews.Author: MsEdmondson
Reviews.Content: There is a "resort fee" that you have to pay if you partake of the associated activities or not. Although they sounded fun (Crabby Hour and a Chocolate something), we were there a short time and had places to see away from the hotel, so we paid that for nothing. But it is a clean and pleasant hotel a walk away from anything the Inner Harbor has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at Pier 5 hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaT099
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Pier5 and had a wonderful time. The staff was very friendly and accomodating by getting us tickets to any events and having them ready for us right at the front desk for pickup. My son loved attending crabby hour between 5:30 -6:30 for crab cooking demos. The hotel was in a great location and we could walk to most of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ashalee16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our wedding. We had a rocky start as the hotel "lost" our reservation but they made up for it by upgrading us to a suite since it was my wedding night. The suite was honestly nothing special and I have stayed in much better hotels with better rooms but the staff was friendly, it was clean, and I have no complaints so I'd recommend it and probably stay here again if the price was right, this time ask for a view of the harbor since ours was a view of the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “A botique hotel located in the Inner Habor with nice looks and little substance.”
Reviews.Author: bookbuff73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cute in that Ikea-eqsue so-called botique style. Most surfaces such as door, railings, etc are painted with cheesy faux finishes. Our room was on the third floor and the air conditioner was insufficient for August summer heat. House keeping did not clean the room when we returned in the late afternoon. Overall the location was great but the service and very warm room dissapoints.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable & great location”
Reviews.Author: BellesLola
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming staff. We felt it was a great price for the view & location. We booked a buy one night get one night free pkg & it was a super deal. The restaurants were delicious. We even got to enjoy a concert on the next pier while dining al fresca at the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and we had a balcony room, which we enjoyed the sites from. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Family_Traveloers
Reviews.Content: I have taken my family to Baltimore the last couple of years (kids 2 and 5) and wanted to try a Harbour Magic Hotel. We tried the Pier V and we loved it. Friendly staff, beautiful room, clean, and the best location. They treat you like family. The staff seems to care about the sucess of the hotel and your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place, concerned about the security”
Reviews.Author: Potuswhs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel and loved it. The Hotel was great and the surrounding area great for tourists. The only concern was I accidently left a video camera in the hotel room on departure. When I called to to claim the camera from lost and found, no camera was found. This concerns me as I was though that the only people that would have access to a room would be the cleaning staff and if that camera was not honestly placed in the lost and found that someone has dishonestly claimed this device as theirs. I would now think twice before booking a room at Pier 5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service! Beautiful Room! We Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTaf
Reviews.Content: A special birthday weekend had been planned - 3 months in advance. Wanted all to be perfect - and it was. Front desk was efficient & personable. Our room ( 2 Queens, Harbor view) was beautiful, complete with a fresh Stargazer lily! Everything attractive & immaculate. Outstanding location, able to walk most everywhere & enjoyed music - outdoors, there on the Harbor. Needed a little extra time ( 1 hr) next morning before check out, this was graciously granted, as a special brunch had also been planned & knew we would need time to return to room afterwards & check out. I have not seen customer service like this in a long, long time. Looking forward to returning !

Reviews.Title: “Stayed after my daughter's wedding there”
Reviews.Author: MarylandKid_At_Heart
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night after my daughter's wedding and reception held there. Everything associated with the wedding was great. Great food and service. Lee Johnson and Donna did an excellent job. Waitstaff and bartenders also did a fantastic job.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: diommazzo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here las month and we're welcomed by a very friendly reception staff and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The hotel is charming (right on the water) and has great harbor views. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Overall a great place to stay and a great location to explore the Inner Harbor area of Baltimore. Dana & Rob (Short Hills, NJ)

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location to stay on the Inner Harbor. The staff was excellent, in particular, Empress, at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: RickGallo
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 Hotel has an excellent staff and has a great location to all Inner Harbor attractions. Just a short walk to and from Camden Yards. I will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, great location!”
Reviews.Author: gapgrl4496
Reviews.Content: Love this beautiful hotel!! Rooms are to die for -- they have vault ceilings and a wonderful view of the Harbor. The hotel doesn't have that big chain feel either -- it has it's own little niche and is very unique, but in a good way. Lots of restaurant choices as you are RIGHT in Inner Harbor. You won't need to take your car out at all during your stay to get around to the sites. I would highly recommend staying here in Baltimore :)

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tbear035
Reviews.Content: Worst customer service experience from a hotel that I have ever been a part of. It started with check in and valet where nobody seemed to want to help us get our car parked. There was one person working the front desk at 4:30-5:00pm on a Friday, so check in took forever. After that, guests were having a hard time locating bell hops and carts to take their luggage to their rooms. I was told there were only 3 carts for 55 or so rooms. That doesn't make sense. The night shift front desk clerk was completely rude and condescending when we approached him with a door key issue. After issuing us a new key, he walked with us to see if it worked. After he tried it and it was successful, he said "maybe you shuold learn how to use your key" in a very demeaning tone as he was walking away. Needless to say, he got an earful and the manager got a call from us at 1:30am at his home to voice our displeasure. A completely unacceptable way to speak to a paying guest in the hospitality industry. I thought maybe a complimentary breakfast or something would have been offrered as an apology, but nothing. Even when we did order room service breakfast the following morning, it arrived cold. We stayed here because I was in a wedding party and the festivities were held at this establishment. Needless to say, I will never stay here again and if I am ever a part of another wedding here, I will walk from an adjacent hotel. The hotel was nice, but the staff was awful. The only thing preventing me from grading the staff a "1", is because there was one staff member who was gracious and very helpful in sewing a button back on the jacket of the groom who was about to get married.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud”
Reviews.Author: 1mwhite1
Reviews.Content: Rooms and service were nice. I was very unhappy with the noise in the lobby. I thought ballrooms were where wedding parties were to be held, not the lobby area. Little did we know that they were in this hotel. Not just a few people hanging around which would have been fine. Probably about a hundred people with a DJ and caterer set up in the lobby. We should have been informed of the potential noise before we made the reservation (but why would they). If it were not for the air conditioner running (on high) we would have had no sleep. I would suggest the hotel try keeping parties under better control and plan it better. The star rating is generous. For the price of the room I would suggest other Hotels in the area. Everything is in very close walking distance so do not feel like you will be to far from all the action. I let the front desk know at check out and the gentlemen said, " I am sorry to hear that." In no way did they try to correct the issue. Look for other hotels. My advice will save you frustration. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fun, and SEXY.........not for kids Awww”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy3n
Reviews.Content: The service is GREAT The Staff are GREAT The rooms are cool to romantic, but definately upgrade for a harbor view worth the few extra bucks. Needs a breakfast service or dinning to be perfect. Again the staff are very attentive, pleasant, & accomedating to every need. A must stay if you can get a good deal, a bit pricey at normal rates. The rooms, location, and service make it worth the money. But check the website for deals often or sign up for web emails to be sent to you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: thewestonchick
Reviews.Content: Checked Trip Advisor before booking and all the ratings were very positive, which is why I wanted to stay there. I will try briefly to explain why I was disappointed. 1) Called hotel to make a reservation at 3:00 p.m. on the day of my stay...they would not allow the AAA discount. However, I hung up and booked the same room on the internet, with the AAA discount, just minutes after my conversation with the reservationist...what's with that? 2) After checking in, we were advised that there was to be a party that night in their lobby and that things "might" get loud...which indeed was true. Why was that not disclosed when speaking to the reservationist PRIOR to making a non-refundable reservation?? Perhaps I would have chosen one of their sister hotels instead. 3) I think that for the charge of $242.00 (before tax, etc.) I think one should find an impeccably clean room...not one with carpeting that did not look vacuumed and a sink that did not look like it had been cleaned/sanitized. I did not complain as I was told at check in that the hotel was booked so I knew there would not be another room to move to. I'm sorry...but I expect a spotless room when I'm paying those prices. I was truly disappointed as I thought the location of the hotel was great and was looking forward to experiencing a positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a better staff”
Reviews.Author: wildelk2
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 is next to The Baltimore Aquariam and Hard Rock Cafe, and has a Water Taxi stop at its back door (Pier 5 on the Water Taxi schedule). But more than that was the super-friendly front-desk folks and valets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, will come again!”
Reviews.Author: freespirit74
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for one night over Memorial Day weekend while traveling to MD for a wedding. We did not get to the hotel until almost 8 at night and had to leave mid-morning, so it wasn't until the next day that I realized how close so many places were to the hotel. It's within walking distance to several shops and restaurants, the Aquarium, Little Italy, plus it sits by a marina so you have access to boating. I want to plan another trip to Baltimore where I can stay longer, and I will stay at this hotel again. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Plus in the hotel itself there are a couple of nice restaurants and bars, and the lounge area is very pretty. The reason I'm giving this a 4-star rating is because there was a prom going on the night I was there, and so it was a bit difficult to enjoy the hotel amenities thanks to the teens taking over and the loud music. The rooms are very clean and I was able to sleep very well-in spite of the prom events-thanks to the fan in the room. I'm not sure if the parking is free or not. I had my car valet since the parking deck is a bit of a walk from the hotel, and we had quite a bit of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Here for business, would come back for pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: MVF59
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, extra friendly and helpful staff. Convenient location to everything on the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: TBradz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night over Memorial Day paid $208 which included tax. Then there was parking and the $10 resort fee. The staff were all very friendly but Empress was amazingly helpful. We were able to check in early, stayed on the third floor. The room was big and clean, could use some minor updating, but the lighting really needs to improved. The room had catherdral ceilings so not if that was part of the reason. Not a big deal though. Can't beat the location. Totally would suggest you put Pier 5 on your short list of hotels to stay at while in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice classy Quiet Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: msarquis
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the action but still far enough that you don't hear any noise. Close to great restaurants, shopping or simple leisure walks. Hotel is classy very helpful staff not crowded at all.

Reviews.Title: “Orioles Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Beggg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a Friday and a Saturday night at the hotel. We went to an evening Orioles game the first night and day game on Saturday. The Pier 5 Hotel is maybe a slow 20 minutes walk to Camden Yards. In between is the Inner Harbor, a fun place for a drink or a meal. The hotel was a tad pricy, we thought. This is perhaps understandable because of its location. Plan to park your car and walk. Everything is close, including Fells Point. Security was fine, we never felt like we were in a bad neighborhood. The room was fine. It looked like there was supposed to be a mini-bar or a refrigerator, but the only thing was the void where something had previously been. The bed and down-filled comforter was great. The TV was really archaic. There was free WIFi. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse and a McCormick & Schmick's Seafood Restaurant adjacent and within the property proper. The only complaint was with the website. We booked a special in January which promised that the second night would be free. We picked dates in May, when the Orioles played the Washington Nats. When we checked out, we were told that the special had ended. After very little complaining on our part, the hotel made it right. They honored the special. All-in-all, a fine hotel mostly because of the location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: AngieBear21
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely friendly. Valet Service PERFECT. I do not recommend the Tuscan Grille that is attached to the hotel - unprofessional staff and incredibly slow and inattentive to patrons. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse - Wonderful food and service!!

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore has great restuarants but take comfortable shoes. Lots to see.”
Reviews.Author: bchgrl63
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely long weekend with geat food and fun. weird weather at this time of year sunny, windy, warm, cold, rainy all in 5 days. Nice hotel Pier 5 not too big, great service.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl07405
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying at Pier 5 Hotel. What a disappointment it turned out to be! The service was embarassiing. The first morning, I realized that they didn't give us shampoo and conditioner, so I asked for some. Fine, no big deal, it was just an oversight, right? We stayed 2 nights, so they only had to make up the room on the middle day... they didn't do it! They never made up the room... at all. We got back to the room at 6pm and realized that not only had they not made up the room... we obviously had no clean towels. So I called and asked for towels. She said no problem. I called again 40 mins later... still no towels. At that time I also informed them that the toilet wasn't flushing properly and would soon overflow. Another 40 minutes goes by.. no towels, no toilet fixed. I went downstairs and talked to the front desk and asked for towels and maintenance.. she said no problem. Finally at 9pm we decided to go out for dinner and on the way out had to explain that we still have no towels and no working toilet. Upon our return at 11:00, we had a pile of towels thrown on the bathroom counter and the bed was still in shambles. The used glasses were still there... nothing else had been touched.. but the toilet seemed to be working. In addition, we paid $9.95 per day for something.. still not sure what it was.. but it was supposed to include water bottles each day which I never got since our room was never made up. The room itself was fair. It was very dark since outside our window was a brick wall. Oh well.. next time I'll try the Hilton :(

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for downtown stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rwd100
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 is located within walking distance of all the Inner Harbor attractions. Once we were parked, we didn't need vehicular transport to go to the ballgame, club at the Power Plant, or shop in Fells Point. Hotel was well maintained with a unique and stylish look that made me feel like I was at a resort -- not a major city, downtown, hotel. Staff was very attentive, helpful, and curteous. Catered food and fine dinning were excellent. Overall -- great stay !! recommend highly for a downtown get away.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreGirl01
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Once you book your reservation they send you information about events and places to go in the area, which was wonderful. They also were able to upgrade us to a room with a harbor view and deck for a low price! Would def. reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a Baltimore visit”
Reviews.Author: pgauch
Reviews.Content: This place is near all the attractions and restaurants. It's modern and clean and the staff are very friendly. We chose this place because it is pet friendly with no additional charge!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: denise8720
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay and the area. Loved the room with balcony and view of the the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit to Pier 5 and it keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: Connie06
Reviews.Content: WOW. Just returned from our third visit in less than a year. Perfect location and room. Our pup travelled with us again and she was weloomed by the staff. Empress is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! She warmly welcomed us and made sure that we were aware of all the activities going on and offered new suggestions. She is such an amazing asset to the hotel. She makes you feel like you are the most special guest. KUDOS TO EMPRESS!!! We also visited the Admiral Fell's. GREAT property also. Great management team. The reception on Saturday was done this time by Stephen (Allison had done the tours on our past two visits.) He was fascinating and informative. The managers were always on hand to help with assuring that everyone was taken care of. Management was so actively involved at both hotels. Very happy with our third visit. We are already booked for our next visit this summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: slm60columbia
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a hidden gem. It is located within walking distance of the Harbor: a dozen or so restaurants, the National Aquarium is literally 5 steps away. You only require a car if you plan sight seeing activities outside of the general area surrounding the Harbor. I walked to the stip Mall and window shopped and had a slice of vanilla bean cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory; a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The entire hotel staff (day, afternoon and evening) are extremely polite and helpful. The conference rooms were comfortable and my room was also very clean and comfortable. My sister drove up from Virginia and we decided to dine at a Brazilian restaurant "Fago de Chao". The food was EXCELLENT. Since this review is about the hotel, I will limit my comments to just the one word. If you are in town, you must go to this restaurant. My only recommendations to prospective travelers is if you are not an early bird, make sure that your room is not next door to housekeeping services. They are up bright and early (around 6am/7am) and since my room was next door to their room, I was started out of my sleep. Overall....I rate this hotel, its staff and the location - EXCELLENT If another opportunity presents itself, i would stay at the Pier 5 Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mad003
Reviews.Content: The staff was very gracious in helping us find activities to do while in Baltimore. The public areas and rooms were very clean and well appointed. My wife even said that this is the first hotel that we've stayed at in a long time that she didn't feel like she needed another shower after taking a shower! We will stay there again if our travels lead back to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and excellent location that we found very relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: bringontherain
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Easy access to great food and the National Aquarium. The harbor was relaxing and we sat out late into the evening, enjoying the view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all around and exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: alectric
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in with the valet and front desk until checkout I had exceptional customer service from every single employee at this hotel. The location is excellent located in the Inner Harbor and easy walking distance to Little Italy and Fells Point or they provide a shuttle that can be used. The hotel is tastefully decorated and very very clean. Bed was very comfortable. I attended a conference here and the facility was comfortable and very accommodating for our size group.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: TootieSanAnselmo
Reviews.Content: My reservation needs were graciously honored. I called in on our late arrival while on the road and the desk person at the time greeted me when we finally arrived at 1:00 am and noted she had read my reservation needs and they were fulfilled. The staff was very responsive and gracious, providing us with google driving directions to a restaurant in DC and back. The manager was very involved and visible, sometimes manning the front desk. The presence and visibility of the manager was most likely a contributing factor for an exceptional staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Pier 5 Hotel, it was an exceptional hotel experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 is a fantastic find.”
Reviews.Author: NCMS
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed staying at the Pier 5 hotel for many years. The staff Chris Burke, Empress Neal, and Jill Rudnicki have always treated me so kind, and are very helpful in every way. The location is amazing. I highly recommend staying at the Pier 5 on your next trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great time..”
Reviews.Author: SqrlNtkn
Reviews.Content: Attended friends wedding held at hotel and stayed overnight. Wedding was beautiful. Great venue for a wedding. Food was excellent. Hotel was very nice. Rooms nice. Even ordered romance package for my husband and I- had rose petals around room, chapagne and choc. covered strawberries waiting for us when we arrived. Champagne could have been colder but it was fun none the less. Parking can be a pain down in inner harbor irregardless- beware.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: grab_md
Reviews.Content: Staff is great, and we loved the Chocolate event! Restaurants located in the hotel provide a delicious menu. We only stayed one night because this was a business event, but we will come back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: gbradhopkins
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful in preparing for my trip offering options to enhance our visit (via email). Once we were there, the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area tremendous location”
Reviews.Author: bimmerguy10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very friendly relaxed staff. Crabby hour and the chocolate fountains were a very nice perk. We valet parked our car Friday afternoon and never touched it again until we departed Sunday morning . Inner harbor, little Italy and federal hill are steeped in history and fun entertaining things to do. We intended to go back to watch the Red Sox beat the Orioles at Camden yards.(lol). I highly recommend Pier 5 and the Baltimore experience. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at pier 5.”
