Reviews.Author: poohnear91302
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pier 5 Hotel due to our son being treated at Johns Hopkins. We had a wonderful experience. We also took or small children to the National Aquarium. It was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent location and accomodations!!”
Reviews.Author: elmardaw
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The decor, the rooms and especially the staff were incredible. I attended a wedding in the Harbor Club and the food was wonderful as well as the staff and atmosphere. I have had the same feedback from all of my family .

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Manuel Antonio National Park, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “can not wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: costaricacouple
Reviews.Content: enjoy area, every thing was awsome. it was raining when me and my wife went. the sun would have been nice. dicks bar is a must. full of surprises.

Reviews.Title: “this was the best hotel that i have ever stayed out from the time i checked in to the time i checked out”
Reviews.Author: mandyandadam
Reviews.Content: Peir 5 was an excellent hotel. I would recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway or even a family getaway. They will do any thing to better your stay. Lots of site seeing and restaurants. 3 in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, with good restaurants and great water views.”
Reviews.Author: dwdavenport
Reviews.Content: Great and interesting hotel. Three very good restaurants with nice bars. Excellent location and on water.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Meetings and to see the ships!”
Reviews.Author: cptnemojr
Reviews.Content: I went to Baltimore for a few meetings being held by my company at the Pier 5. As my taxi pulled in I was really exited to see the USS Taney is right next door to it! I am a huge Naval history fan and since I usualy sneak out from my meetings to see some history this was really a plus. I can just walk outside and there are several historic ships within minutes and the National Aquarium is next door! The lobby is very spacious and I love the colors. My room was roomy and the bed was great. The bathroom even had a floor heating lamp with a timer which made for great early morning showers. There are 3 restaurants in the hotel. The first night I ate at Ruth Chris's Steakhouse and it was really good. The pricing is high but I expensed it. The seccond night I ate at McCormick and Schmicks. Hint: Try the Rockfish, its fabulous! I also tried the room service which is done by the McCormick's and the burger was perfect. Meetings went well and the staff was very helpfull. Their front desk supervisor (Empress Neil) was a big help with everything I needed. I did not have enough time to try them but I saw a lot of restaurants and stores within a short walk (Hard Rock Cafe, PF Chang's, Best Buy, Filenes Basement, etc.). All in all a great hotel in a great location. I have to go back with more time so I can see the aquarium!

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Luxurious Experience”
Reviews.Author: Grammyof4
Reviews.Content: The staff and services at the Pier Hotel are exceptional. Couldn't have asked for a better weekend getaway. Close to all the happenings in Baltimore. Very comfy room. Very clean. This will be where we stay whenever we are visiting Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: huntley55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pier 5 Hotel in Baltimore actually for a primarily Washington DC sightseeing trip. We drove into DC after the rush in the morning, saw the sights and drove back after the evening rush. It was so nicecoming back to our relaxing water view room and not even having to leave the hotel to have a great dinner. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, room were gorgeous, price was reasonable.We plan to do a similar trip this year and will stay at Pier 5 again. Wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reservations”
Reviews.Author: starlight1010
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip planned in advance. Because the prices went up, they did not want to honor a rate adjustment. Well that would be one thing, the actual problem was that when I spoke to a manager, I was told one of the reasons they wouldn't adjust the price was that it was a big weekend and there were large parties. Which to me meant they didn't care about my little reservation because they had big parties that would take the room. That to me is the worse type of customer service. I've visited alot of hotels and usually they will go out of their way to make you feel like a valued customer. This hotel did not, from the get go. We will happily find one that will.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for a family vacation, a refreshing alternative to the big impersonal chain convention hotels.”
Reviews.Author: guest054
Reviews.Content: It really is on a pier -- right on the water, steps from the aquarium. Small, personable, doesn't nickel and dime you like the big chain hotels. Great for families as result: there's so much to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: bear008
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from the middled of the United States, My colleague and I arrived in Baltimore, We were tired and probably a little rough looking after 22 hours of driving. When we saw the Pier 5 Hotel at the Harbor we decieded to see what they had to offer. We were greeted by a lovely young woman who had excelent customer service skills. She not only assisted us with rooms but gave us a complete list of attractions and eating establishments within the Harbor area. The Pier 5 Hotel also has ample parking available for travelers. I would highly recommend anyone staying in the Baltimore area to stay at the Pier 5 Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"So so" service”
Reviews.Author: FuatK
Reviews.Content: Room looked really nice and unusual. Location is perfect. Service and helpfulness of the staff could be much better. I would replace whole staff members of that hotel, very bad management...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pier5, as my fiance' needed surgery at Johns Hopkins. I researched Baltimore's Inner Harbor area hotels online, and discovered the Pier5 which was conveniently located near the Metro as well as Johns Hopkins Hospital. The staff at this hotel were incredibly responsive to all my needs and were very supportive throughout my stay. I am looking forward to going back to stay at the Pier5 again; this time for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing (which is an understatement!)”
Reviews.Author: renae77700
Reviews.Content: We arrived (with pet in tow) at 2:15 PM not realizing that check in wasn't until 4 PM. That was OUR fault! So Ben (the front desk representive) pre-booked us and took our cell phone number. We walked the nearby pier area with our pup enjoying her time. By 3 PM we were so hungry, we went back to see if our room was ready yet. Alas, it was not.... but Ben checked to see what he could do to help us out, since he knew we couldn't go eat with our dog along. The room had reserved was one of only two in the hotel, and neither were ready!!!!! Ben checked and found a room that was not booked that night, and simply stated that it was an "upgrade". AN UPGRADE? He gave us the nicest room in the hotel! A king suite with 3 balconies all with harbor views. One of the most incredible stays in my life !!!! We will recommend everyone we meet to stay here. Thank you Ben for making our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: Jrcuboulder18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is filthy! The furniture is old and stained. The bedsheets and mattress pad are stained and have multiple holes. We thought we got a good rate till we saw the nasty, dirtiness. Also, be aware, there is a $10 tax for this property and a $30 parking fee, so add $40 to the rate you are quoted. The property is in a good location, but I am staing at multiple hotels from my balcony in the same location...I'd rather be at anyone of them! I have no idea how this hotel is rated so highly on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!, Great Staff! and Beautiful view of Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: JBonham81
Reviews.Content: I did some business travel with my imported pharmaceutical sales company back in mid October and had a very pleasant experience at the Pier 5 Hotel down in the Inner Harbor, Baltimore, Md. Jill R. the assistant hotel manager there made my stay there very enjoyable. She was friendly, down to earth and treated me with the up most respect upon checking in and through out the course of my stay. Everything that I needed was accommodated for, and I did not have one complaint the entire week. Cleanliness was a top priority and exceeded my expectations. Next time I am due back in Baltimore, I will be staying at Pier 5 Hotel and hope to deal with Jill again.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking a professional feel”
Reviews.Author: srhmmj
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this property. Check-in was painstakingly slow and most rooms were not available at 2pm yet. I had an upgraded room (corner-suite) which proved to be big with sizable bathroom but no bathtub. The one huge downside was the very noisy wall-mounted AC. Nicest feature was the balcony which allowed for great views on the harbour. Used conferencing meal service only.

Reviews.Title: “A perennial favorite”
Reviews.Author: KikiandHP
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the hotel and each time I come away reminded how much I enjoy this hotel. Great location, close to great food & activities. Crabby Hour with Jill is a treat and a great welcome to Baltimore! The shuttle to Fells Point/Admiral Fell Inn is a wonderful bonus and the best desserts in town can be found over at the patisserie there. The McCormick & Schmidt's downstairs offers great seafood and a wonderful view

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view, but not much else....”
Reviews.Author: AndrewC60
Reviews.Content: After years of visiting the Baltimore Inner Harbor, my girlfriend and I decided that we needed to make the Pier 5 Hotel our next weekend getaway. We booked a 3 night stay October 8th - 11th. Arrived Friday early evening and were greeted by a cheerful front-end staff, and a happy hour that helped put us in a great mood for the weekend. Our room #204 was a corner suite, with a fantastic view of the harbor. Unfortunately, that's about all the positive to report. Our suite was in desperate need of renovation. The bathroom has less than adequate lighting, and the height of the countertop makes one feel as though you were a professional basketball player (I am just under 6 feet tall). The first evening uncovered a mattress that has seen better days, and an in-wall air conditioning unit that woke us each time it came on throughout the evening. The fact that the AC unit is 3 feet from the bed obviously did not help matters. Breakfast at Pizzazz in the lobby gets a thumbs down. The restaurant lacks organization. Upon seating, we noticed that our tablecloth was dirty. We give credit to the waiter for sensing our displeasure and immediately moving us to another table. Unfortunately, the second was as dirty as the first. Eggs came out of the kitchen, but toaster was on the buffet counter. Coffee urn was empty when we were seated, and took forever to refill (No, it was not crowded). You leave this restaurant feeling awfully confused. If you choose to eat lunch or dinner at one of the restaurants located off the lobby of the hotel, I strongly urge that you confirm your reservation with the restaurant directly. It would be prudent for a hotel to advise their guests if a restaurant will be closed for a private function, which neither the hotel nor the restaurant felt was important when they closed at 4pm Sunday for a wedding reception. Telephone service is horrendous. You have no choice but to dial 0 from your room for any needs. The inadequacy of this phone system was never more apparent than Monday at checkout. We tried for 15 minutes to call for a bellhop. Phone rang, no one answered. Finally we carried 6 bags out to the valet without any assistance from an employee. Save your money. This location leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: GWMAC11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pier 5 several times now, and each time I go I'm even more impressed than I was at the end of my prior stay.  The rooms are immaculate, the staff is helpful and courteous, and the location can't be beat.  I'm always particularly impressed with the small gatherings and activities they plan for the guests.  This last stay, I enjoyed both a chocolate tasting, as well as a demonstration on making crab dip, which, needless to say, was incredible. The past two times we've stayed here, one of the managers, Jill, has been especially helpful in providing an excellent list of restaurants and activities in the area.  I'm also fairly sure that she was the one responsible for the heart made out of rose pedals that was on our bed when we came back from dinner one night. My wife loves that kind of stuff. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Special place with a smiling staff”
Reviews.Author: bobsizlac
Reviews.Content: I was at The Pier 5 Hotel for a wedding. When I checked in the manager empres was very kind and had the biggest smile on her face. I knew it was going to be a great stay at that moment. I was then introduced to the other manager Jill at the crabby hour and chocolate fountain and was blown away by her kindness. Jill made me and my wife a reservation at the spa and talked to us a bunch during our stay. My wife even said she felt like Jill was an old friend and she does not usually like women that attractive talking to me. We will be back for New Years Eve. Thanks Pier 5 Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Discusting”
Reviews.Author: jim6025
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel experiences! The hotel room carpet was so dirty that I didn't want to take off my shoes. There was an awful oder they were trying to cover up with so much air freshener that it made you choke. The staff was rude and unempathetic about the situation.Very unprofessional and unhospitable. NEVER stay there! There are many other choices with a view that are not much different in price. Very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location with amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: nnejttam
Reviews.Content: This was the best location to the Inner Harbour by far. I have children ages 8 and 5. We walked to all attractions and the children loved the pedestrian walk. We were lucky enough to see crabs and jelly fish in the harbour water next to our hotel. Staff at the Pier 5 was amazing. Friendly, helpful and the Crabby Hour was a nice extra. Jill the asst. Manager was beyond spectacular. This is a must stay. We will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be any worse!!”
Reviews.Author: terryvaz
Reviews.Content: It was to be my brother in laws special birthday present. His wish was to stay at the Pier 5 Hotel overlooking the harbor and having dinner at Ruth Chris. Needless to say I booked two very special rooms 6 months in advance to ensure that my husband and I could fufill his wish. I also called 2-3 times to confirm these reservations. Each time I called I was reasured that everything was set for my dates. I also received an e-mail confirmation. We drove to Baltimore from New Jersey only to arriive at the front desk and hear that we no longer had the rooms because something came up or!!!! someone better than us 4 had decided they wanted the rooms. As we were standing there we noticed all others checking in with no problem. Needless to say this is totally unacceptable. What they didn't realize is what they did to the reputaton of their properties, Yes all three! You see Pier 5 and their sister properties are the only hotels that my firm uses while conducting busuness in Baltimore. However!! this will no longer be the case.. Oh yes! with all due respect to Pier 5 they did hand me a sheet of paper detailing the accommadations they made and paid for at the Springfield Inn. Which I found to be the most depressing room. I must say Pier 5 you ruied what could have been a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A definate "Yes" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobynMyers
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this place. The venue is very "boutique hotel" like right on the water and in a great, central location. (OMG---Filene's Basement is right across the street. My palms were sweating.) The room (we had 2 double beds) was spacious and very clean. (I'm picky about that.) It was decorated very festively in funky colors--purple and orange I think-- and had a great flat screen that sat on a large, wide, attractive entertainment center. The lighting in the room was great and unique. Here's another big plus...they have a sister hotel in Fell's Point...Admiral Fell's Inn maybe(?)... and after a day of pub hopping there (which is a must if you enjoy beer) you can jump on their shuttle that will take you back to the Pier 5 free of charge. Nice feature. The staff at the Pier 5 was very friendly. Special kudos to "Empress" who welcomed us at the front desk. She is pretty unforgetable. When we were there they offered a happy hour type get together that included complimentary food, beer and wine. It was very nice and we met some nice people during that. The only thing that I would have liked to see is a small fridge in the room to store beer, pop, snacks. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come stay again!”
Reviews.Author: amya123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so pretty and in a great location. I loved the view of the harbor from the room. Crabby Hour was so fun and the hostess Emporess was so friendly and entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was great. Made us feel right at home.”
Reviews.Author: meangreen04
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Jill hooked my wife and I with tickets to see the O's play the White Sox's. She also recommended this very nice Italian place to eat dinner at our last night there. It was our first trip to Baltimore and it's a place my wife and I will be going back to in the future. The trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGo70
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great find. The hotel is inviting, nicely decorated, and has friendly staff. We checked in at 11:45am and they had a room ready for us. Our room on the 3rd floor was spacious with vaulted ceilings. At 3:00-4:00 on Saturday the hotel hosted a chocolate fondue bar for guests. The aquarium is literally right next to the hotel and 1 block away from PowerPlant Live, restaurants and shopping were right in reach too. We upgraded to the Harbor Nights package for an extra $10 and we recevied free continental breakfast (if you want to order off the regular menu they will take $7 off - $14 total), 2 free drinks in the hotel bar, and 2 free drink passes to each of the bars at PowerPlant Live. FYI, parking is not included in the hotel price but there is plenty of parking near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob98567
Reviews.Content: The overall experience at Pier 5 Hotel was fantastic. Jill, the manager, was extremely friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You for you help and kindness”
Reviews.Author: Redhotpicker
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I recently got lost in Baltimore on our trip to Pittsburgh. We asked Katherine, at the information desk for help and she gave us a google maps set of directions. This helped us out a lot. We saved a lot of time and aggravation trying to find our way home. Thank you for your kindness. God Bless... Paul & Lynne Heagy, Clairton, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: sandrap77
Reviews.Content: I travel quite frequently for business and the Pier 5 Hotel in Baltimore is one of my favorites! Their staff is extremely personable and friendly, and they constantly go above and beyond to make sure my stay is the best. And, I can't say enough great things about Jill Rudnicki. She always makes me feel so at home!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect good service here.”
Reviews.Author: sjw-trip
Reviews.Content: Our daughter got married at the National Aquarium and we stayed a the Pier 5 for the day of the wedding. Although we were told that early check-in (1:30pm) would not be a problem, it was. We reserved 3 regular rooms and their best suite for the bride and groom. No rooms were available when we arrived and after 30 minutes of entreaty they said they did have a room but it was $20 more. Their delay for a mere $20 delayed our entire wedding. In addition they turned over the $600/night suite with no air-conditioning on a 100 degree day - so hot inside the room that the windows had to be opened. Another guest arrived at 6:30pm and their room was not ready. Another guest's reservation was lost. A request for a stool was never answered. Breakfast next morning took 1.5 hours before food arrived. Other requests were never satisfied. The hotel never compensated us for the lack of air-conditioning and was in general unhelpful. Do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Rooms not worth Price”
Reviews.Author: megatodd2
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I won a free night at one of the Harbor Magic chain of hotels in Baltimore with the Dining & Spa package included at a wedding showcase. This was our "second place" prize behind a fully paid wedding for 100 people. BIG difference between that prize and what we won, but lets focus on the hotel. Check-in went smoothly and the staff seemed very friendly in the large lobby. The only options for parking were valet parking for $39 or lot/garage parking for $22 per 24 day. We opted for the garage parking which was located across the cul de sac street. Since we won the room and package, we werent sure what kind of room we would receive but found ourselves getting the "infamous" room 305. (see previous review a couple of reviews down) The first thing to notice is that we had to use the room key in the elevator to access the third floor. I guess this may be for security reasons, but it could be a hassle when our hands were full, such as coming back with breakfast the next morning. In the room itself, there was an overwhelming smell of baby powder. It didnt bother us too much and we got used to it, but it was definitely noticeable when we first walked in. The room had just the basics...king bed, two phones, flat screen tv (with terrible picture from the standard cable...no HD in this place), a desk and one chair. There was a large empty area over by the A/C that looked like it had room for another table and/or a couple of chairs. The ceiling was very high and there were separate lights in the edge around the room that could be turned on for some "mood" lighting. The walls were painted purple and yellow which looked modern and bright. There was no patio, just a railing right outside the door. The view was partially of the harbor, but only at an angle. It was more of a roof view than anything. You could see the giant flag on top of Federal Hill though. The bathroom was basic with Koehler faucets and shower fixtures. The tub had seen some wear and tear, but it wasn't horribly bad. Perhaps if I was paying over $200 for a room I might have been upset. But for our free night, it didnt matter to me. In our room for the Dining & Spa package were the "Limited Edition" wine glasses and corkscrew and two mini bottles of wine. The rest of the items were in an envelope given to us at check in which included a map, free drink coupons, a $50 spa or dining voucher, along with a coupon book and the contintental breakfast vouchers from Pizzazz. In my opinion, it really was not worth an upgrade to us. We are not big wine drinkers and most of the drink vouchers and coupons were for places over in Fells Point. With one night on our stay, we didnt even venture over to Fells Point but stayed mainly in along the Harbor. The most negative thing about our trip was that blasted air conditioner. It was LOUD...very LOUD. And, even though we had it set to constant fan, it would shut off for no reason throughtout the night. Then it would be quiet....very quiet. Until the A/C turned on again and then it would get LOUD again. On and off, loud and quiet, all through the night. It was a major distraction. The location of the hotel is great....you cant get any closer to the National Auarium and the Harbor. For the price (we would have paid if we hadnt won the trip), I don't think it is worth it. Also, they automatcially charge $10 for internet service. Our "free" trip ended up costing around $100....$16 for internet and taxes as well as $22 for the parking and $60 for dinner at Ruth's Chris. (even with the $50 dining voucher) Do try the Crabby Hour if you go.....free crab cakes or crepes along with drinks. That was a nice distraction before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and so pet friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Connie06
Reviews.Content: Thank you Pier Five....great location on the water and great staff. From the wonderful valet team to the front desk team, we all enjoyed our stay!!! Jill and Empress were fun to talk with. They offered ideas for city visiting. The entire staff treated our pup so special! We had a standard room and were very happy. It faced the street but was very quiet. The room was a great size and we had no complaints at all. We LOVED the receptions offered by Admiral Fells and Pier 5. Pier 5 had "crabby night" on Friday. We could bring the pup and enjoy crab roll ups and drinks. The Fells property had a reception with cheese and drinks and then a ghost tour through the property provided by Allison....very good and she was very informative. Can't wait to go back in the fall...Thank you all for making our pups first "vacation" so special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: leeser416
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to Pier 5 (standard room) after checking into their sister hotel, Brookshire Suites (from a suite) and realized they had no air conditioning. We looked at this hotel originally but felt the price was too high for us. We came to Baltimore to see the aquarium with our 2 year old. This location was much better. The room was spacious and clean. Our old problem was that we were hoping for a suite and ended up switching to this hotel into a standard king room...which meant we went to bed when our 2 year old eventually gave into sleeping! The staff was very nice. I would recommend going to a different place for breakfast. The Pizzazz Restaurant was not great. We received breakfast vouchers...if you get them - stick to the continental breakfast that is included in the voucher. I wouldn't venture onto ordering from the menu. Overall this location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stressful Stay”
Reviews.Author: GoldwingRider48
Reviews.Content: We went for a wedding in Baltimore and reception at Pier 5, Booked two months in advance, no rooms were not ready, some were double booked and personel were VERY RUDE. Waited three hours for a room to become available that we booked with a harbor view, unless you strained your neck the view was not there. The staff and managers caused so much stress for the friends, families and parents that it put a real damper on the whole event!!! I have had much better experiances at hotel 6 than this over-priced, poorly managed, dirty hotel. Oh and the air conditioner was loud and undersized for the room. I am NOT a complainer but this was an unexcepable experiance.

Reviews.Title: “A great travel experience”
Reviews.Author: roger351
Reviews.Content: This June27th, we spent our 35 anniversary at the Pier V hotel. Our experience there was nothing short of wonderful! The staff was very attentive and filled our every request. Our room was well appointed and had a beautiful harbor view. We had a great time at the Pier V and the Inner Harbor, making out 35th even more special. In the future we will surely return to the Pier V and will recommend it to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “"A Magical Experience"”
Reviews.Author: APR1956
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. I absolutely LOVE it, and my only warning is that the prices really go up for special occasions--our rate for July 4 was $400. However, it is pet friendly and our dog had as much fun as we did. If you love Baltimore's Inner Harbour, this is easily the best place to stay. It is right ON the bay, and is practically next door to the National Aquarium. The staff is wonderful, and the service is fantastic. There are three restaurants attached to the hotel, and I particularly recommend McCormick and Schmidt's which offers room service. It is an exceptionally fun place with special events in the lobby most days. I would suggest trying to book early to get better rates, but otherwise they live up to their promises.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tayljohn1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel for the location, the restaurants, the crabby & chocolate hours & friendliness & helpfulness of the staff. We would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location does not make up for poor quality of room."”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Sylvia
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations, but were very disappointed with the condition of the room. It turns out that a “standard” room does not include an arm chair and coffee table, just a big empty space where they would have been located. The worst part was a very loud A/C that kept cycling on/off—it did not have a “fan-on” setting with the A/C (i.e., fan on, but A/C off)—which made sleep impossible. Other problems: wobbly desk chair, ripped curtain, squeaky bathroom door, no cuts, and clogged bathtub. Cheap motels have better rooms. Without a harbor view, you should save your money and go elsewhere. Good points: location (but can be noisy with concert shell and Inner Harbor noise), free Wi-Fi, and they nicely agreed to cancel & refund my second night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference at Pier 5”
Reviews.Author: RJV1968
Reviews.Content: I recently attended the TIDES conference held at Pier 5 Hotel. Accommodations were great and the room and service outstanding. We even had time to visit the aquarium adn take a water taxi around the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is the top value offered by all employees”
Reviews.Author: csm1357
Reviews.Content: All the employees encountered during our stay were knowledgeable, helpful, and professional in their dealings with us. They often went out of their way to help us. Without a doubt, management has instilled Customer Service as the top priority with their folks.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel along with the staff!”
Reviews.Author: isser99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the opposite of what my friends and I thought it would be. We did not realize how great the location really was until we got into our room with the great balcony overlooking the water. We had an amazing time right down to the staff, My friends and I come to baltimore every year and we had such a great time this time mor ethan any other times in the past. Katherine Hunt was even more helpful by giving us the better rate for the room as well. Tnhanks again and look forward to coming back!! Jason Wolek

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL !!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyn316
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time ! We could walk to everything we wanted to see. The food was good. The room was big and we had a good view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “great stay on water”
Reviews.Author: jbpinnacle3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and Jada the front desk attendant took great care of my wife and I. She deserves a promotion because she is very friendly and accommodating to the guest. The only thing that I did not like was our view out the window ad the breakfast was horrible. Other than that everything was great and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel - Not Magical at All”
Reviews.Author: DogMomTravel
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately a big disappointment after reading favorable reviews and checking out the website. Not sure if they got rid of half the staff but hard to find a bellman, front desk clerk, or housecleaning. Harbor View room is very misleading -- dark and no view (unless you stick your head out the sliding glass door to a nonexistent patio). Stained carpet and bedding. Housekeeping took towels in the morning but didn't make up room/replace towels for at least 4 hours! Never seen such a thing in all my travels (and I do a lot of travelling). Had to send breakfast back twice.

Reviews.Title: “Service From the Minute We Walked Through the Door”
Reviews.Author: PMF98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I expected that we were going to have excellent service the minute we greeted by the doorman of the Pier 5 Hotel in Baltimore, MD and we were not disappointed at any time during our three night stay. Everyone we came in contact with on staff was genuinely warm and courteous. The front desk was efficient and gave us good tips on dining and what the Inner Harbor had to offer in addition to booking reservations and arranging shuttles or cabs on a moment's notice. Travel can occasionally be a challenge for us since my wife has MS. This hotel is easy to navigate, offers excellent accomodations and is central to all of the major attractions that the Inner Harbor has to offer. We can't say enough about the staff. Special kudos to Richard (doorman), Jada (front desk) and Roland (our frequent shuttle driver). There is more to see in Baltimore and we plan on staying at the Pier 5 on our return trip. Peter & Lori Finn Leonia, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, quite, right on the water.”
Reviews.Author: weeblo123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Pier 5, Inner Harbor Maryland. We found the room to be clean and quiet ,and the staff friendly and always eager to help in any way, especially Jada at the reception desk. The hotel is conveniently located right on the water with a beautiful view. We would definitely stay there again during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds, homey happy hour”
Reviews.Author: J0T
Reviews.Content: Knew it was going to be good when we pulled up and saw a prime steak house and great seafood place under the same roof as the hotel. The hotel itself was in the harbor area, just a stone's throw from the aquarium. Staff were friendly and accommodating. I left some of my materials for a presentation at home, and was thoroughtly surprised when I inquired about a copy center within walking distance and the front desk offered to make copies for me. The bed was to die for. And where else can you go and have your own personal hostess teaching you to make Maryland crab appetizers--Empress was a sweethart. I regretted not making arrangements to stay the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 was great!”
Reviews.Author: HRBOnancock
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Baltimore was extremely enjoyable in large part due to Pier 5's helpful, knowledgeable staff and lovely hotel. The location on the harbor is the perfect spot for getting to some of Baltimore's famous sights. We didn't have to go far for dinner--two great restaurants next door. Our room was clean and comfortable and had a view of the harbor. It was a nice surprise to have the beer, wine and crepe party going on while we were there. It was fun. A special thank you to the young lady that checked us in upon arriving (5 May, 4:00 p.m.). She answered all of my guestions, gave me a map and provided tips on the local restaurants.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, will most certainly return.”
Reviews.Author: jmz_03
Reviews.Content: Came to Baltimore to see the Orioles and Red Sox. The location was perfect, and the staff was really helpful. I didn't know the area, but Jill was very helpful in telling me how to get where I needed to go, and also with any questions and needs I had at the hotel, like getting to a pool at a nearby sports club. It was a great stay and I'll definitely recommend it to friends. And the O's swept them!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: something12345
Reviews.Content: The lady who helped me, Jill, was extremely friendly and accommodating. I felt like I had a great room for a great price! The hotel staff was timely and answered any questions that I had. I would definitely go back here. I would recommend this place for both business and pleasure, families and solo travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Bmore at the Pier 5”
Reviews.Author: caredo323
Reviews.Content: The location of the Pier 5 is ideal in terms of convenience- we could walk to the inner harbor, acquarium, camden yards, and great restaurants. It's also a beautiful location looking out over the Baltimore Harbor. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was lovely. In particular, Jill and Empress who hosted a nightly "Crabby Hour" with local beers and wine and demonstrated how to make crab crepes. It was a fun for us and our kids, and they were nice enough to wish my little girl a Happy 5th Birthday over the flat screen TV in the lobby. All in all a great stay. We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “MAGIC Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: PACornfield
Reviews.Content: Pier V was incredible, we had a wonderful long weekend. Upon arriving I was sure to introduce myself to Empress. She is, after all, a TripAdvisor celeb! She certainly lived up to her reputation. My boys (11 and 7) were immediately enchanted. We did the Crabby Hour (yum!) and the chocolate bar (double yum!) with Empress as the host. The boys couldn't wait to show their stuffed animal crabs from the National Aquarium to Empress. We wanted for nothing all weekend. Although the hotel was extremely busy with three weddings, it did not at all interfere with our stay or the service we received. The room was clean and large and the air conditioning unit provided great "white noise" all night. Wouldn't even have known there was anyone else in the place. Thanks to Pier V and the good folks there we had a "magical" weekend in Baltimore! And we heartily recommend eating at Santino's in Little Italy and grabbing chocolate canolis at Vacarro's. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: trudy2587
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent business trip to the Baltimore City region. The Pier 5 was chosen as the conference site. I had visited the harbor before and never knew that the hotel was at such a great location. From the moment I checked in to the the moment I checked out I was truly impressed. The front desk staff was so courteous and helpful about local destinations. The facilities were excellent for the business conference. The decor was very chic and modern. The room was much bigger than I expected. The view from my room of the harbor was beautiful! My room was very clean. Thanks to the cleaning staff. Overall I would return to this hotel for business or personal travel. I highly recommend Pier 5 for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mtm213
Reviews.Content: he service was excellent! We couldn't have asked for a more pleasant check-in. There was no wait, and the staff was friendly and attentive. Our room was beautiful, we had a lovely patio, and a great view of the harbor. The location was convenient to downtown and walkable to many harbor attractions. It was enjoyable to be slightly off the downtown hub without losing any convenience. We able to safely walk to the harbor and look forward to coming again for a future pier 6 concert! I really can't find any complaints about the Harbor Magic. Our favorite aspect was probably the Crabby Hour. The hostess was engaging and fun. A great way to start a downtown evening!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mcapozella
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 Hotel in Baltimore, MD, is a great hotel for the perfect stay in Baltimore. My husband and I found the hotel, clean and the staff extremely helpful. We plan to return to Baltimore and would definitely stay at Pier 5. We could walk to everything and we were able to "catch the magic". A very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Best Location”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreMom2boys
Reviews.Content: You can't get any better than Pier 5 with regards to location or staff. The staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Absolutely LOVED Crabby Happy Hour. My kids tried crab dip for the first time - and loved it. I thought the hotel went one step up by giving us a free glass of wine during the cooking demonstrations. the Happy Hour was just FUN. Our room was huge and very clean. My tween son loved the Wi-Fi. The location was literally steps away from everything. It rained when we were there and we were so happy that we could run 200 yds or so to the entrance of the aquarium. Great harbor view.

Reviews.Title: “What a Way to Start Our Life Together!”
Reviews.Author: CutcoSteve
Reviews.Content: Our Trip to the Inner Harbor was amazing. The Pier 5 was incredible. And most of all the staff was beyond outstanding. We were celebrating our Mini Honeymoon immediately following our wedding and I almost want to say that I wouldn't have traded it for a full honey moon. I am such a high maintnence person and the staff went above and beyond to make all the little details I had dreamed up in my head a magical reality. Thanks Pier 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: RileyOmaha
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and responsive to our needs. We enjoyed the extras the hotel offered to their guests, included chocolate fountains and crabby hour. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Romantic, Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: kdeanes
Reviews.Content: I snet my son and DIL to Pier 5 on a surprise night out. My son recently returned from a deployment to Haiti with the U.S. Navy. He and his spouse were in desparate need of some alone time. I searched the web and Pier 5 was just the type of hotel I was looking for. It looked unique and not the "cookie cutter" type hotel with all of the usual trimmings. The colors were beautiful and attention to details was not overlooked. My son and his spouse said they had a wonderful, relaxing time. The room was very clean and the bed was heavenly! The staff the encountered were helpful and knowledgeable. They ate dinner at Ruth Chris Steakhouse. They said the food was incredible. After dinner they took a stroll and said the night was just beautiful. Numerous places to eat or shop and conveniently located close to Pier 5.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has such potential but...”
Reviews.Author: mherb
Reviews.Content: we had a horrible night there. It is a very nice hotel on the outside and is located right by the Inner Harbor. I have stayed at many hotels around the world and I have to say that this was my worse nights sleep. We had made reservations and asked for a crib to be placed in our room. At check-in yesterday we verified that we should have a crib in our room. They told me they were out of cribs but would have one for us shortly. Fast forward to about 3 hours later and still no crib. Our crib didn't arrive (after 2 phone calls) until after 9 pm. 2 1/2 hours past our babies bed time. We had a room that was facing the front of the hotel right by the Ruth Chris's Steak House. You could actually hear conversations from their outdoor eating area. The walls are paper thin. There was also a band playing on the opposite side of the hotel. They played until after midnight and it was so loud I could hear all the words to the songs. At about midnight our obnoxious neighbors (with a baby and toddler) came back to the room. The walls are so bad we could hear their entire conversation. The rest of the night involved neighbors being loud, their baby screaming, a bug crawling up my pillow, and an ear piercing alarm clock going off at 5 AM. We did get the VIP package which included aquarium tickets and breakfast in the Pizazz restaurant. The breakfast was okay but the staff was very friendly. The valets and reservation hotline people were also very nice. The gentleman at check-out asked how our stay was and I told him the things that had happened. He was nice but didn't really say much about anything. He just told me there were a lot of babies there using cribs. That is fine but when it is 3 hours after you know you need a crib I would expect you would have it ready. Also, it wasn't actually a crib. They just handed us a pack and play at the door. As for the room quality, there were spots on the carpet, sheets, chips of paint off the wall etc. Which is not a big deal if I get a good nights sleep. They really should look into getting more organized and getting some insulation! Also, beware there is no free parking. It costs $35 a night. Also, they add a "destination" fee of 9.99 to your room charges. That is fine if you actually need the use of a fitness center, business center, etc. It should be an option not a mandatory charge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: tpebbles
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel was located in a great spot. It is near so many Baltimore attractions. The hotel itself is beautiful and very clean. The staff were all very accommodating. I really like how restaurants were attached to the hotel. Unfortunately we were only able to stay over 1 night, but I would really like to go back...only with my husband and not my friends! Definitely a great place to stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolute pleasure to stay at Pier 5”
Reviews.Author: ParryvilleRalph
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel and had a fabulous experience. Everyone of the staff members that we came in contact with was friendly, courteous and knowledgable. I would definitely recommend this Hotel...the location is great. We were within walking distance of everything! The drawback was that we could only spend one night!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: NCMS
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Pier 5 at the Inner Harbor is always such an enjoyable and pleasant stay. The hotel is located directly on the water, which makes for a perfect location. The staff at Pier 5 definitely make it a priority to ensure your stay is a magical one. Empress, Jill or Chris are always available to assist you in any way possible. We will continue to return for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing getaway.....”
Reviews.Author: kaz3367
Reviews.Content: One word to describe our stay just this past week at the Pier 5 Hotel was AMAZING. The staff, location, service is wonderful. They are extremely friendly and very helpful at this hotel. This was our second stay at the hotel and we brought our dog with us this time. Yes they are a pet friendly hotel at no cost :-) Our dog also had a wonderful experience at the hotel and met a few new friends. One of my favorite things at the hotel besides the breath taking views of the harbor from your hotel room is Crabby Hour. This is there cocktail hour in the lobby where they actually do a cooking demonstration and give out samples of what they make and complimentary wine and beer. The samples are amazing. If you are looking for a fun, friendly staff, and great location hotel Pier 5 is where you should be staying...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in the Heart of Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: vtrugger
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival at the Pier 5 hotel, I knew that my stay would be fantastic. The hotel juts out on a pier overlooking the Inner Harbor, which boasts some fantatic views of the harbor and city. As I walked into the front lobby, I was greeted by a delightful young lady by the name of Jill Rudnicki who had extensive knowledge of the hotel, what it had to offer, and things to do in Baltimore. One thing that I do recommend doing is the "Crabby Hour" put on by the hotel and hosted by Empress Neal and Jill. It was a great event to come back to after a long day of meetings. Although my stay was brief, I attribute my wonderful stay to the Pier 5 hotel and its wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: MickiGreenwich
Reviews.Content: If planning a trip to Baltimore or the nearby area, I would highly recommend the Pier 5 Hotel. It is ideally located right in the Inner Harbor and in close proximity to shopping, relaxation (Spa Sante), & fine dining (Little Italy / Fells Point). Of course you don't even have to leave the hotel if you don't want to, as you have access to several well known restaurants (including Ruth's Chris Steak House & McCormick & Schmicks) right through the lobby. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated. It has a trendy yet comfortable feel to it, and the staff could not have been more accommodating. They also offer free shuttle service to many of the local hot spots. The rooms and lobby were emaculate, and they even have extras such as Friday night "Crabby Hour" to start off your weekend. The value received for the price paid far exceeded our expectations. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 was a vacation within itself.”
Reviews.Author: irishgrl06
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 hotel had a friendly and very helpful staff. It was very clean and beautifully decorated. Our next trip to Baltimore we will be staying there. I will be recommending the hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A very unique and pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: infinitexxstar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem! From the minute we checked in, the service was very friendly and outstanding. The staff is very knowledgeable of the area and provided us with great recommendations and quick cab service. The location is superb. Our room was very unique, clean, stylish, and spacious - and had an excellent balcony view of the Inner Harbor. We were very happy with our stay. The Pier 5 is definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Location is incredible.”
Reviews.Author: Headshredder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pier 5 hotel in Baltimore for our 10th anniversary. We were very impressed with every aspect of the hotel. Location,cleanliness and the hotel staff made this a very special occasion. We were very impressed with Wilson our Valet for most of our stay. He was courteous,respectful and very classy. The hotel would be very wise to hang on to Wilson.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: dagdabrew
Reviews.Content: Loved tis hotel - used to stay in the city elsewhere but liked the proximity to the places and events on the waterfront that I enjoy. With Ruth's Chris and McCormicks attached, it is like a dream come true for any discerning traveler. The staff are all helpful and resolve any issues promptly. I found my new hotel in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: jgrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed while visiting my son who is a student at JHU. I was very pleased by the hotel. Very comfortable beds. The service was great. Everyone was very friendly and very helpful. Location is great. I have stayed at other hotels in the harbor but I would highly suggest staying at Pier 5.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, beautiful location, phenomenal service.”
Reviews.Author: baltimoremusicscene
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Pier 5 and were immediately impressed with the courteous service, and friendly staff. The assistant manager, Jill, was extremely helpful and accommodating. Our trip, start to finish, was made even more memorable thanks to the help from Pier 5 and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Pier Five is a fabulously warm, perfectly located, guest friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MarksPattyG
Reviews.Content: The Pier Five is a wonderful hotel. Guest check-in is fast and the staff are courteous and accommodating. The rooms are beautifully decorated with furniture perfectly situated- the view of the marina is a gift within itself! My stay was business related. Our meals were wonderfully prepared, timely and well maintained, which provided for a comfortable dining experience! Hats off to the banquet staff who worked the US Dream Academy's function for three days ensuring that our meals were fresh, hot and delicious! Thanks for the coffee, tea, soda and water! and the cookies, the cookies were great! (2/14 to 2/17)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About It!”
Reviews.Author: Robin2010
Reviews.Content: This brand spanking new hotel is just so lovely. The room was exquisitely decorated. The bed fabulous. Water view from the bed. The location is perfect: walking around Inner Harbor is easy peasy, you are right smack dab in the middle of things. My husband is disabled and he even had a great time. Felt safe and comfortable. The luscious food at McCormick's was divine (our waiter was smart and kind and gentlemanly). The food at Pizzaz was also delish. Front desk folks -- Empress and Benjamin -- were aces, as were the doormen/bell hops.

Reviews.Title: “When in Baltimore, I will always stay at the Pier 5 Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fritzlove
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Jill Rudnicki , the manager, with a huge smile and warm welcome. Our trip was not for pleasure and she could sense it. She took that extra step to helped us with our arrangements on how to travel to John Hopkins Hospital and provided us with maps, etc while trying to make this trip as easy as possible. Richard, who helped us with our bags, our car and room service was a pleasure- each and every time we saw Jill and Richard greeted us with a comforting smile and said to us " if you need anything , please let us know ". Thank you so much and we will always stay at the Pier 5 hotel as we will be returning many times

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Cozy and Ready for the Holidays!!”
Reviews.Author: KarlaRez
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend came in from Minnesota to spend Thanksgiving with me, and with his relatives who also live in the area. We planned on staying in Baltimore because of the night life, and it's closeness to his friends and family. I knew from the second we walked into Pier 5 that we had picked the right hotel. I am a HUGE fan of holiday decor, and the entire lobby (which has a grand 'I'm important' feeling) was beautifully done, complete with one of the biggest Christmas trees I've ever seen! The desk staff was very friendly, which i expected from the friendly phone call I had received earlier in the day asking if they could assist in planning any special events during our stay, including making dinner reservation! We ended up having dinner at the small Italian restaurant right on the first floor of the hotel. The food was fresh, HEALTHY, and delicious, and the ambiance was great! Candlelight and Sinatra?? Yes please! Our room was really spacious with a great view of the harbor. Yes the picture you have of my boyfriend and I hugging in the moonlight on the patio is accurate. It was very romantic. It is was a truly great start to the holiday season!!

Reviews.Title: “Visit here once, I'll guarantee you will want to return.”
Reviews.Author: steelboon
Reviews.Content: We stayed over New Years Eve weekend, a wonderful place to be. Even tho it rained, and we missed the fireworks, the cocktail parties in the lobby with Empress were such fun. The rooms were great, beds fantastic, location ideal for dining and sightseeing. The staff was very accommodating, especially Empress for the help she gave our group (5). Even Bentley, the dog, had a good time. We plan on returning next New Years and hope to get waterfront rooms this time. Wonderful! Joe and Connie Steelman

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: shasheltat
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. From the time we walked in to the time we left, we were pleased. From the front desk to the Valet Parking attendant. We ordered service to the room and it came very fast. The location of the hotel couldn't be in a better spot. Everything is within walking distance ad when I say walking distance I mean a 5 min walk. They have a Ruth Chris steak house and a mccormick and schmicks right on site. Let me just say that if you are going to the Baltimore Harbor, the Pier 5 hotel is a must stay. TRUST ME

Reviews.Title: “m”
Reviews.Author: sullivanmh
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Baltimore. Pier 5 hotel was in a great location and had very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Definitely stay here if you're in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “You'll do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mm2travel
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading some very good reviews while discounting the bad ones. I should have given the bad reviews more credit. THE GOOD: The valet was very polite, helpful. No problems there. I will say that the hotel charges $32.61. for this service, which I believe to be too expensive to charge guests. The front desk was of low professional caliber (training?) but I believe she was trying to do her best. Location is convenient. THE BAD: Other reviewers have mentioned the paper thin walls. TRUST me! They are not only paper thin - we actually had to be subjected to the guests next door and their "activities", all of which we heard and - I KID YOU NOT- made the connecting wall move! I swear. Hubby and I made a joke out of it but, seriously, we've never experienced this anywhere. Can't imagine how shoddy the construction must be for this to happen. Beware of booking (and paying extra dollars for) a harbor view room. We did and were assigned room 304. SEE PHOTO. Having paid extra for this "view" and being disappointed to see a view of roof lines and obstructions, we requested a deduct off bill. We were told by front desk to contact the manager, which we did. After explaining the "view" to her and being told several times that it IS still a harbor view room, she finally agreed to deduct the additional cost down to a regular room. She was nice and did the right thing but I wish I wouldn't have had to plead my case when it is was so obvious that this room should not be classified as a harbor view room. It really should be taken off that listing and customers should be informed of the obstructions. WiFi is NOT free. There is an additional charge of 9.95 listed as "destination fee" that it falls under. I hate these frivolous add-ons. One last thing: Every time the staff answers the phone, they say, "How can I make magic happen ...." Not only does this get old, but it is so corny and insincere. Management/Corporate needs to drop this line. It's too easy for it to become a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Go Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: Quilter447
Reviews.Content: This is the first time my husband and I stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel and we would definitely go back again. The hotel is great - spacious rooms, nice lobby, fun decor and friendly, helpful staff. Best of all, the location can't be beat - right on the water, close to everything in the Inner Harbor, but still somewhat private, with lovely views from every room. Baltimore is one of our favorite destinations for a weekend away and Pier 5 is our new choice for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “From the moment we arrived until we left, everyone was extremely friendly and made us feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: RGLNashua
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel beause of the location, restaurants and that it was pet friendly. We have a small dog and it worked out extremely well.The convenient location to everything made it easy to get around expecially in the cold weather. All the staff from the general manager, who we met, to the front desk and door man were extremely friendly and helpful. We ate at 2 of the 3 restaurants and got the same treatment. We plan on going back this summer to take in a ballgame and hope to be able to stay here again. We would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: TripperNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pier 5 Hotel the weekend of 1/1/10. Overall, it was a great experience. The hotel is in a great location, super clean, helpful staff and our two room suite was amazing! We got a great deal on the cost since they were running a special, but even if we had to pay full price it would have been worth it! (Family stayed in a standard room, and also got a great deal. A free upgraded room with a view for some reason!) Our suite was huge, and we had two balcony's overlooking the water! It was beautiful. I am a super fussy traveler, always worried about security and cleanliness, but no worries on this trip! We wanted to check in early due to our morning flight arrival, but they did not have a room ready. I wish I could remember the name of the lady on duty when we arrived because she was so helpful. She stored our luggage and even called my cell phone when the room was ready, which was only a few hours later. My only negative comment would be that I wish they had a shuttle service to and from the airport, but we had no problems finding a private shuttle service at the airport. They do have a free shuttle that we used many times over the weekend to go into Fells Point and that was great! I can't wait to go back to Baltimore, and for sure will stay at the Pier 5 Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Really did make the trip Magical”
Reviews.Author: Joeatar
Reviews.Content: I won this trip in a scilent auction not expecting anything to great since it was a donation. But, as soon as we walked in the door it was just beautiful. The service was great from the time we pulled up. The valet was the man. When we pulled up he asked if we needed help with the bags, and when we said no he insisted and put them on a cart to take them to our room. Once we walked in the room we were once again suprised, it was so beautiful and surprisingly large. We did not even have a Harbor view room but when you looked out the window, all you could see is the water. We got there right around 5, which if you have not been to their web site is "Crabby Hour" where they make a dish using local ingredients. Empress is a great host and makes sure you are having a great time. If not with the show, by offering a delisious locally brewed beer or a glass of wine. What adds to the show is the banter back and forth from Empress and Jill one of the front desk receptionist. Overall this hotel made out trip. It is located in a beautiful location. They are surrounded by great entertainment. If you need any suggestions on something fun to do just ask the front desk. I do not have one complaint about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JuiceyMaryland
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years Eve and New Years Day at this hotel. From the first moment we walked in the door the service was super. The hotel is very modern and up to date. The rooms were light and airy and the beds were so very comfortable. The cooking demostration at 5:30 each day is not to be missed and they even serve beer and wine, what fun! An employee of note was " Empress" she did every thing possible to make our stay a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Pier 5 Hotel & Fells Point!!”
Reviews.Author: koreanlover
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel & was taken care of immediately by the Host at the front counter. It was my girlfriend's birthday getaway & she LOVED it. The rooms were beautifully decorated & the view of the harbor was out of this world. I wish i could LIVE there!! Nice Restaurants are adjoining the hotel from all sides. Even though we had reservations & went somewhere else very nice, my plan is to stay & dine at the hotel next time. I want to go to the acquariam next time as well - right across the parking lot!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly wonderful staff made the stay memorable and fun.”
Reviews.Author: Love2getaway24
Reviews.Content: Every member of the staff that we came in contact with during our stay was helpful and caring. The employees seem to be connected to each other as well as to the customers, in a kind and caring way. It was a very comfortable down home sort of feeling. They had a warm and welcoming happy hour with crab speciatlies and provided excellent concierge service for access to the Aquarium, and dining ideas. I wish we could have stayed longer....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and great way to ring in the new year!”
Reviews.Author: Commissioner37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the Pier 5 as part of the harbor magic nye package. Kim the reservation specialist helped us with all of the details and we were very pleased with how the package turned out...my wife was very happy!! We were given a room on the 3rd floor with champagne and party favors. The hotel had its own NYE party that was great with casino tables and the best view of the fireworks. The hotel lobby and rooms were uniquely decorated and very clean. The valet service was quick!! There is a Ruth's Chris in this hotel that is excellent and the Pizzazz Italian restaurant had a delicious breakfast buffet. This hotel is close to everything the harbor has to offer and the staff was friendly and professional. We will definitely come back to the Pier 5 Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: apples16
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of my favorite hotels. I have to admit that the slogan, "How can I make magic happen for you?" always makes me laugh but then quickly reminds me of how accommodating and helpful the staff really are. I especially had a great time at the Crabby Hour held on Friday night with Jill and Empress. Their demonstration on how to make crab crepes was wonderful! The rooms are always nice and our balcony overlooking the harbor couldn't have been better. I will definitely be back for another stay when visiting Baltimore again!

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 Hotel - stellar service and nice room amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Hunter-O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pier 5 for a job interview. The location seems really good, but I wasn't in town long enough to really take advantage of the close proximity to all the good stuff in downtown Baltimore. The lobby is posh - very nicely decked out and very clean. The room was very clean as well, with a nice bay overlook on the balcony. Very fast internet LAN connection came included for the price... this was a huge plus in prepping for the interview the next day. All these things can be found in many hotels in the same price range. What really set apart the experience apart was the customer service from the front desk. These people really went out of their way to help with anything they could. They even offered to have the maintenance guy bring me some extra AAA batteries! When I needed to get to my interview the next morning, they hooked me up with transportation. Unbelievable service, truly. Bad service totally kills a hotel experience for me... Pier 5 gets a hands-down A+.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience - Pier 5 Magic”
Reviews.Author: cubanalite
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The location is perfect for downtown harbor excursions, the staff went above and beyond to meet our needs especailly because we were traveling from out of town and needed early check-in and late checkout to accommodate our flight schedules. Empress Neal was especially remarkable in ensuring our experience was perfect. Thank you, Empress. The hotel activites are planned with attention to detail and we will definitely stay at Pier 5 on any and every return to Baltimore. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: 17chase
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great rooms, top shelf food in Ruth Chris Steakhouse. Two room suite is huge. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4713
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was wondeful. My daughter was married at the hotel and the weekend couldn't have gone smoother. The staff was attentive & went out of their way to make our stay very special. Stephanie, the wedding coordinator was so proactive and extremely professional. It was apparent she has had a great deal of training and years of experience . She anticapted our every need. The rest of the staff during the reception were equally as attentive. They responded promptly & with no questions asked. I highly recommend the hotel. Baltimore is a great city and the location of the hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Rose petals and chocolate covered strawberries”
Reviews.Author: Big_Kahuna8
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Wife walked into the room and saw rose petals on the floor leading to the king size bed and chocolate covered strawberries. Set the tone right off the bat. The Experience Specialist, Empress, was particularly helpful in recommending some good spots to visit that evening with my wife as well as allowing us to check out a little late so we could grab lunch at the hotel restaurant before heading to the airport. Stay was awesome and will not hesitate to stay again next time we are in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Had to sleep on a cot or pay $50 extra!”
Reviews.Author: abura
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:30am and were told that if we wanted to check in at that time we would have to pay $50 extra. We were told that checkin was at 4pm so we asked to have our luggage stowed and toured the city until we returned at 4:15. When we returned, we were told that only a room with 1 king bed was available- there were 4 of us! We reserved a room with 2 double beds and were told, rudely that we checked in too late! Huh?! So basically we were being extorted into paying $50 to get the room of our choice. I have NEVER had this happen at any other hotel. So 2 of us were forced to share a cot which was so sunken in the middle that we had to put the mattress on the floor for some support. For the amount we paid per night this was unexceptable. We also had to ask several times for more towels and we never received our complimentary newspapers on either morning of our stay. Staff was obviously incompetent, there is no free parking here or free internet. The location and cleanliness were the only positives about this hotel. We noticed that there were many other hotels around the Inner Harbor area, whose location was just as convenient. Next time, we will try one of those!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Baltimore with First Class Staff.”
Reviews.Author: BudandSissy
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 is my FAVORITE Hotel in Baltimore. The rooms, the views, the location and the most friendly , professional group of people you will encounter. The staff will ensure your stay is special. This is a first class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: BrianPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay and the cleanliness of the hotel. The staff was wonderful and a special kudos to Jill Rudnicki as she was pleasant and polite from check-in to the happy hour that she hosted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Sabrinacallie
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 is in a great location, and you can easily walk anywhere around Inner Harbor. We got a "parlor" room which was really two previous small rooms with a wall knocked out. The sitting area had two chairs, a small couch, desk, chair,fridge, and dresser with a nice flat screen TV. The balcony was very tiny with high brick walls (no view). There was a HUGE heater thing on the wall, and the room was plain and almost shabby. The bathroom was average. The sleeping area had a king with a great mattress, dresser, end tables, etc. The harbor view was a stretch only if you leaned out the window. The patio door on this side opened to nothing. The walls must be so thin because we could hear people talking on both sides. This just never happens nowadays! No kind of table to sit at and eat which you would expect in a suite. Overall we expected much more for the cost of the room. Check-in isn't until 4, and check-out is noon. The lobby is beautiful, and the staff was wonderful. We especially appreciated our wonderful bellman. There are two fantastic restaurants connected to the lobby, and this is a nice plus now that the weather is colder. We just stayed one night to visit the aquarium, and it was adequate for that. They do have that nice crab and chocolate activity at night, although it was too crowded for us. We would go back but shop around for a cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasent experience>”
Reviews.Author: WonderingT
Reviews.Content: I found the staff friendly and personable. The hotel has a "Crabby Hour" hosted by a very polite and friendly hostess(unfortunately her name escapes me) where different crab concoctions are prepared for you to sample accompanied by microbrewery beer and regional wines. Accomodations outstanding and great food. This hotel is a jem tucked along the Inner Harbor. I enjoyed this venue far greater than the larger chain hotels in the area. The food is great on the premises. You are within easy walking distance of Little Italy with its restaurants. The rooms are well appointed and I slept well. The only criticism is that the television picture was a bit distorted. I will visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: feelingfine1234
Reviews.Content: I want to tell everyone that this hotel was such a wonderful place to stay while having to go to Johns Hopkins. From the moment my family and I arrived we were treated with a friendly smile and provided immediate assistance for unloading our car. Katherine Hunt was prompt in returning my phone call to get our rooms situated for our stay. The hotel was clean, safe, inviting and convenient to local restaurant. I would highly recommend Pier 5 to all my family and friends who plan on visiting Baltimore. Carter family West Virginia

Reviews.Title: “This is a magical habor visit.”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyrocco
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about our stay. After staying in an "in-town hotel" the previous night with no amenities. We walked into your hotel and were magically surprised. Every question was answered with a smile and a positive answer. Way to go!!! The room was everything that we had hoped for and with a view!! We met a lovely woman named Empress, who made our stay even better. All of you are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A TRIP !!!!”
Reviews.Author: blauer1939
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in baltomore more than 100 times for business and this stay was the best ! its all about the staff especially the concierge .she was the best helping me with a dinner reservations and her nightly happy hour was the best,i will be back thanks pier 5

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Patrisha99
Reviews.Content: great location Great place to stay Would stay here again We stayed on the third floor and we had to use our key to access that floor so we felt safe. The view from our room was beautiful wish we had better weather though. Next time we come back it will probably be in the spring

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5: Baltimore's Inner Harbor Magic!!”
Reviews.Author: HarborBella
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 Hotel is defeinitely the place to stay while visiting Baltimore. I was there the weekend of October 9 for a Fundraising Weekend for a non-profit agency here in Baltimore. There were so many activities going on in and around the hotel, it felt like we were having our own Mardi Gras!! The room was beautiful and spacious, as was the bathroom (thumbs up to the hotel for the eco-friendly toiletries too). We (my guest and I) had a wonderful stay there. He came up from Atlanta to attend the fundraisers with me. Oh, I neglected to mention....I live in Baltimore, 15 minutes from the Harbor, but I wanted to stay at the Pier 5 for a little mini-vacation. It really makes me appreciate the beauty of my city whenever I am down at the Harbor at night, and staying at the Pier 5 for the weekend made it even more magical. Kudos to the staff for their excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip at Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: apugislove
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visited Baltimore Inner Harbor. We had booked a room at Brookshire Suites and due to an overbooking problem, we had the fortunate opportunity to stay at the Pier 5. First let me say that Andrea Carter (Director of Guest Relations at the Brookshire Suites) was absolutely wonderful. She is a very professional, personable lady who does her job very well. She handled our transfer promptly and without difficulty. The Brookshire Suites are very lucky to have her. Upon arrival at the Pier 5, we were greeted by Katherine. Katherine is works at the front desk. Katherine knows her job well. She answered all questions that I had about our stay. Our rooms were absolutely beautiful. We were on the third floor, you needed you room key to get to the third floor by elevator. This was a nice safety feature which is nice when your traveling with small children. My grandchildren are 3 and 4. Later in the evening she assisted us in obtaining more towels for our room, and getting us another remote for the TV. When asking her if we could keep our cheesecake in their refrigerator until the next day, she promptly got us a refrigerator for our room. (Without us asking for it and she always had a smile on her face.) The next morning Benji was at the front desk. Me the coffee drinker that I am, was in search for more coffee. They were out of regular coffee and he offered to go and get me a cup (very sweet, thank you.) Time to check out and waiting for the shuttle that Benji called for us. The marathon event was taking place at the harbor. Unfortunately the shuttle wasn't able to get through due to the closed streets. Craig the valet attendent was very helpful in obtaining a cab for us. Thank you all for taking such great care of us. The Pier 5 Hotel is a wonderful place to stay at the harbor. The staff are great, the rooms are spacious and clean. You can't beat the location close to the aquarium and Little Italy. My daughter said we were pampered during our stay. Our trip was so much better because of all of you. Thanks again, Robin Forrester

Reviews.Title: “The Pier 5 Hotel was absolutely the best hotel I have stayed at!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Teach22Teach22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Mystic Suite for a weekend and I could not be happier with the room, hotel, and service provided. As soon as you enter the hotel the staff makes you feel welcome and comfortable. Benjamin (who was working at the front desk), was very helpful with everything. He was also very knowledgeable about the hotel as well as the places to go in Baltimore. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic location, top notch!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JTFinn
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 Hotel made our trip to Baltimore convenient, exceptional and thoroughly enjoyable. The proximity to all the attractions in the Inner Harbor was the ideal central location to make our family weekend fun-filled and magical. It truly was a great weekend. Thanks so much to the staff and their service.

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 hotel was unlike any other hotel we have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: tjvohio
