Reviews.Content: Most hotels and hotel rooms look the same but Pier 5 was so diiferent with bold colors and different shaped rooms. The different programs that were free, like crabby hour were fun and being right on the wateand so close to everything was fantatic.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel was Overbooked -- Upgrade Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Nottingham_PA
Reviews.Content: The conference hotel was overbooked and my business group was upgraded to the Pier 5 Hotel. The transport from Fells Point to Inner Harbor was OK, but our positive experience began as soon as Cristy (Front Desk attendee, on 09-24-2009 around 6:30pm) offered to check my group in for the night. She was very professional and our check-in wen very smoothly. The rooms were awesome, very clean, and pleasing to the eye. The cabled internet was fast, easy to setup and very reliable. For dinning that night, my group decided on McCormick & Schmick's. The service and food were both fantastic and enhanced the entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: SkiNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Join in the fun of crabby hour and any afternoon programs sponsered by the Hotel. Empress was perfect as our entertainment specialist. We also attended a wedding at the Hotel & Breylen was a perfect waiter for our table. This hotel is in a perfect section of the harbor and the water taxi's took us to all of the other sections. Go to Ruth's Chris while you stay here, it is right downstairs and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing magical...”
Reviews.Author: trav603
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Baltimore on a business trip and decided to stay at the Pier V rather than a chain hotel downtown. While the location right on the harbor is great, the rest of my experience at Pier V was pretty disappointing. When I arrived on an 85 degree day, my room had no air on and had an unbearable musty smell. I asked if I could switch to another room, and neither of the women at the front desk seemed to know how to accommodate my request. One told me there was nothing they could do about it, and the other seemed completely flustered as though she had never encountered this situation before. I did switch rooms, and the second room still had no air on when I arrived, but no musty smell. Other minor complaints... the sheets felt starchy and rough (this might be a major complaint for someone who cares more about having soft linens) and not only is there no option to re-use your bath towels, but they actually replaced my bar of soap each day (i.e., not just left a new one, but actually threw out a perfectly good bar of soap that had been used once). However, the worst thing about my stay at Pier V was the unpleasant surprise at checkout (no bill left under my door, also... had to go downstairs and request one) that I had been charged a $9.95 daily "Destination Fee" in addition to my room rate. This fee covers amenities such as bottled water in the room (which I never drank) and happy hour (which I never went to). It seems outrageous to me to charge guests for unused amenities. Overall, it was a disappointing visit. When I return to Baltimore, I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “messed up my son's wedding”
Reviews.Author: kelleyosborn1
Reviews.Content: we did not actually stay there. we made reservations in June 09 for october 09 wedding for my son. his future wife had booked the entire hotel for weekend of oct 3, 09: reception, rooms, bridal suite--the whole deal. when double checking our reservations (which showed up on the bride's printout), i was told that we were not 1: registered at all or 2: not registered for all of the nights. they had no rooms for us. the hotel desk manager hung up on me. i moved $2,100 worth of room business to Marriott Waterfront. i heard people there are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and interesting place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: SMLBARB
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights here and I have mixed reviews. The check-in and front desk staff were very nice and helpful - we were off to a good start. The room is eclectically decorated - fun and colorful and was reasonably comfortable. But we were disappointed that on 2 separate occasions when we called housekeeping to request a couple of items, 2 hours passed and we had to call again. Although the room looked clean - the carpets needed a good shampooing. The location of the hotel is excellent and parking was so easy. But at the rates charged for this hotel I would have expected clean carpets, a notebook in the room with the hotels internal numbers to call, local services and restaurants and an extra set of glasses for the bathroom. Overall the stay was fine - but I don't think I would stay here again considering the other hotel options in the area..

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: kaugustine98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in this hotel. We had such a wonderful experience. Both Carter and Jill provided us with excellent customer service, tips and suggestions! Crabby Hour was also a very unique and fun experience! We're hoping to come back on our one year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mlo380
Reviews.Content: Extremely contemporary and nice room. Great size and unbelievable location. All hotel employees were incredibly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: obxguy
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Baltimore twice a summer for a number of years to take in ballgames at Camden Yards. About four years ago we discovered Pier 5, after totally unacceptable stays at almost every other hotel in the Inner Harbor. Not only are the prices at Pier 5 far more reasonable than the harbor hotels, we love the two outdoor bars/dining rooms, the proximity to Little Italy and Power Alley as well as the great staff. These are super friendly people who actually act like they are glad to see you and greet you every time you re-enter or leave the hotel. The rooms are nice, internet is free (no wi-fi, so bring a connection), and the views are very good. If I can't book a room here, we don't go to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing going for it.”
Reviews.Author: lbisurfer
Reviews.Content: The location is great for walking to the Inner Harbor, Little Italy or Harbor East. That's the good news. If you enjoy being awaken by LOUD club music at 1 am, then this is the place for you. Sounds travel up in the atrium reception area, and the rooms are not sound-proof, so we got to hear the dance music until it ended. Did not make for a restful night sleep. We will not be spending the night there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was a perfect end to the summer for our family.”
Reviews.Author: dpkmomx2
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 Hotel and its Waterfront Invasion package were enjoyed by all! The hotel staff was friendly, accommodating, and most helpful. The property itself had style was very comfortable and clean. The "crabby hours" were a very nice touch, and most tasty! We'd love to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience for the entire family”
Reviews.Author: JoanSalisbury_Md
Reviews.Content: Great location...on the harbor near all major attractions Friendly, knowledgable, helpful personnel Clean, spacious, comfortable room overlooking the harbor Fast and efficient check-in Crab cooking demonstration was fun...and tasty Fantastic breakfast with friendly service Magic Harbor Package was a great bargain Would HIGHLY recommend without reservation

Reviews.Title: “Stay HERE”
Reviews.Author: PaJkatz
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This place WOWed us from the moment we arrived. The location is perfect because it is with in walking distance to everything including the aquarium. There is parking right beside the hotel which only cost $22. Check in was smooth and when we mentioned it was our 10 year anniversary, Empress (who totally ROCKS by the way, she is so personable and funny and sweet!) gave us one of the newly remodeled rooms on the 4th floor. The room was great and when we realized that we had a really cute balcony with a table and chairs and a view of the harbor, we were floored! The decor of the hotel is really cool and quirky and fun. It's not your typical stuffy sterile hotel, that is for sure. DON'T miss Crabby Hour! Everyday they do a cooking demonstration using what Baltimore is famous for, CRABS! It was nice to have a glass of wine and paticipate in some Crab Trivia. They even had crab themed prizes like crab chips. Yum. Empress made some really fabulous crab dip, and the best part was eating it when it was done! Also it was nice to mingle with a few of the other hotel guests. Later we had a wonderful dinner at Ruth's Chris steakhouse which is attached to the hotel. Aged filet mignon, Ruth's Chris's famous chopped salad, & au gratin potatoes..you cant go wrong! With FULL bellies and a little tipsy ;), we fell into our big comfy bed for a great nights sleep. We will definitely return to this hotel. Really, for the price you can't find a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Pier 5 Hotel in Baltimore was truly Magical!!”
Reviews.Author: Vatraveler80
Reviews.Content: My husband took me and our 2 children to the Inner Harbor for our 10 year wedding anniversary. The staff at the Pier 5 were absolutely wonderful. Check in was at 4pm but we got to the Hotel early in the day because it is a 3 hour drive from our house and they had us checked in and in our room by 11:15. The room was huge and everything was perfect. We had dinner at one of the three restaraunts in this hotel and the filet mignon melted in your mouth like butter!!! My kids enjoyed everything about the entire trip. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Whatta Place!~”
Reviews.Author: kandikiss
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I would like to say that we traveled with out "young child" Mugsy(our dog). The hotel was so pet friendly! I was at first a little skeptical of bringing him, and staying at a dog friendly hotel BUT...my skeptism had quickly subsided upon entering the hotel. The front desk welcomed all 3 of us! The hotel and the rooms were very clean, very close to all the sights( within walking distance - TRULY!) Catherine at the front desk and Im sorry but I dont remember the other wonderful lady's name (she is on the morning shift) were very friendly and helpful! It made our experience a delight! All the staff were EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Hotdogs5
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit Baltimore each summer to see our beloved Red Sox, we love your City. Each year we seem to go to different hotels and this year was no different. This year brought us to yours, and we will never look to another one again! Your staff is extremely courteous as well as professional. We had a terrible accident with the toilet in our teenage daughters room and it happen to be at 11:00PM after the game on Friday evening. However all it took was one phone call to your front desk and two gentlemen came from your very efficient staff (maintenance and cleaning) and they immediately cleaned and rectified the problem. They were so very professional and made us feel so very comfortable considering the time of night. I only wish i asked them their names... Again, thank you for the exceptional service we received from your hotel staff, and we look forward to seeing you again next year!

Reviews.Title: “we have stayed at the grand hyatt in hong kong this was like that”
Reviews.Author: hanover9
Reviews.Content: clean beautiful rooms excellent restaurants close to everything excellent service staff is very polite very professional we are planning a trip this fall to go xmas shopping

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: ChampyMaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel and booked the Waterfront Invasion package for 3 nights that included the VIP Aquarium tickets, VIP Science Center admission and $25.00 gift certificate which we used at Ruth Chris for dinner. Our experience was wonderful. I really liked the happy hour crabby appetizers they held at our hotel. Jill our assistant hotel manager made wonderful crab dip on Thursday than crab crepes on Friday and they had beer and wine also complementary. She made the happy hour fun and we got to see hands on cooking while enjoying cocktails. Saturday was the fun Chocolate extravaganza with fun dessert to dip into chocolate. After we enjoyed our day at the harbor we came back and enjoyed the view from our balcony of the harbor and people watching. Even though we live in Catonsville, it was a fun weekend being a tourist in Baltimore. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel excels in customer service!”
Reviews.Author: LML58
Reviews.Content: My husband was having surgery at Johns Hopkins so our stay at Pier 5 was not business or pleasure. As you might imagine we were anxious about many things and were away from home. From my initial with Empress Neal to reserve our rooms and through out our stay we were made to feel like family. The hotel decor is festive but tasteful. The rooms are well appointed and the views of the harbor wonderful. The beds are extremely comfortable. The hotel is located right on the harbor and is within walking distance to attractions, dining, and shopping. We received a special hotel rate due to the hotels affiliation with Johns Hopkins. The hotel provides shuttle service to and from the hospital from eary morning until late at night. Any requests that I made were handled promptly and efficiently. What particularly impressed me was the level of service we received from Empress Neal and the Assistant Hotel Manager Jull Rudnicki. In an era where exceptional one-to-one customer service excellence has virtually disappeared the work of the staff at Pier 5 hotel excels. We highly recommend this hotel if you find yourself in the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotell ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aashlie48
Reviews.Content: We went to Baltimore to go to John Hopkins. We were amazed with the unique lobby furniture and big room. Everything was beautifully decorated. The walls were painted bright pretty colors, and I always felt safe because you had to have a key to get to the floors with the rooms. Our room had a beautiful view of the harbor where we could see the aquarium, science museum, and the Rusty Scupper. Plus the Water Taxi stops right behind the hotel, so you could get to all the main attractions right on the harbor. And every Saturday they have many things you can dip in there chocolate fountain and on weekdays they have "Crabby Hour" where they teach you how to make many dishes with crab. I would DEFIANTLY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cute design hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust_gemini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right on the water and in the heart of the inner harbor- a small strip of water was the only thing separating our window from the dolphin show at the aquarium! The location was so convenient for strolling around the mall and power plant nightlife area- did not have to worry about the car or taxing a taxi, and felt pretty safe walking around at night. The only time we did need a cab was to go over to see Fells point, and even then it was only ~5-10 min ride. We stayed at this hotel because we were looking for a cute boutique smaller place in the inner harbor and for something different than a run-of-the-mill large hotel, and could not have picked a better choice. P.S. Bring an appetite! Both Ruth's Chris steakhouse AND McCormick and Schmick's are attached to the hotel- should be illegal! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Best In Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: desihamm21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. From the foyer, to the front desk staff, to the exciting events going on inside and outside of the hotel. This was a great place to stay. Rooms very impressive. I was able to walk to a few of my favorite places in downtown Baltimore. I travel frquently to Baltimore and will be chosing the Pier 5 each time. The front desk staff was extremely accomodating, customer service oriented, and just plain nice. Parking is expensive especially if event going on. Valet parking best deal. Hotel very close to harbor and activities so you won't need a car. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Grammyof4
Reviews.Content: This hotel goes "above and beyond", making your stay comfortable and pleasurable. The staff is very accommadating and attentive. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: WTKL
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Pier 5 were so wonderful that it made our stay and will ensure that we stay here again. My husband, 2 year old daughter and I were treated like we were the most important people at the hotel. Nothing was a problem for the front desk staff. The Saturday afternoon chocolate buffett was unique and lots of fun. We look forward to coming back and staying at one of their three hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: GunnyRoc
Reviews.Content: We had the Magic Package only to get the wrong tickets and not all the discounts. Our room had items falling apart and pubic hairs were in several places within the bathroom. The long distance AND the Internet were not working. We ordered a refrigerator to be in the, room it wasn't. Crabby Hour was a GREAT failure, not like the pictures. The ice machine, only one, didn't work and the breakfast restaurant didn't even know they served breakfast which was cold after a long wait. Had a nice talk with Bruce the GM and he showed concern then promptly did nothing to correct the concerns. We were there four days and three nights. The Inner Harbor is AWESOME! The hotel was a total disappointment. This kind of money should have a class act. Parking is an extra $20.00 a day and employees from the kitchen walk through the lobby constantly. The "behind-the-scenes" employees should stay there or look "clean" when around the customers. I gave them a chance to make this a memorable Anniversary...what they gave my wife and me was not the kind of memory you want. Retired Gunnery Sergeant USMC

Reviews.Title: “More budget boutique than great experience”
Reviews.Author: BritishSkier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights. Great location, friendly staff. It's priced as a boutique hotel but is really a budget hotel. It has some nice design elements and probably looked good at grand opening. Now it is a little down at heel, superficially clean but cuts corners on breakfast, toiletries and bedding. Our "harbor-view" overlooked a docked party boat and had an air-conditioning unit that kept us awake all night. If you like Hampton Inn, this will be fine, if you're looking for W then avoid.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: arvidd9
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Aquarium. Pleasant and friendly staff. We had a "harborview" room. It was small and a little worn, but otherwise acceptable, seemed somewhat overpriced. I was overcharged by the parking lot next door both times I used it. They advertised a set of hourly rates as we entered, then charged nearly twice the advertised rates as we left hours later in the evening. They had written new rates on sheets of paper and taped them over the previously advertised rates. If it had happened just once, I might have ignored it. Twice in two days was a little obvious. The Pier 5 is ok, park somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Right by the Inner Harbor & Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: originalcopywriter
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Pier 5 Hotel and I must say it met our needs perfectly. For walking, we were right by the Inner Harbor. For dinner, we were a five-minute walk from Little Italy. And the two places we drove to, the Visionary Arts Museum and the neighborhood of Hampden, were each within 10 minutes. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, safe, central location in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey But Fun”
Reviews.Author: pudge20
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights on the 'buy one night get one free' package they were offering. The package also came with all access passes for the National Aquarium. Otherwise we would have stayed elsewhere because of the price. The hotel was in decent shape, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Its location was what really sold us, we were one pier over from the National Aquarium and within walking distance to everything else. We were surprised the rooms were as basic as they were, considering the normal cost. All in all, great little place, I would definitely stay again if we had another BOGO discount. Otherwise I'd find somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore's Best Kept Secret!!”
Reviews.Author: nlbjork
Reviews.Content: I got married at this hotel in June 2005 and have stayed here several times since for weekend getaways with my husband. We just love the place. The service is always wonderful and they always remember us. We've even received gifts in our room at times. We love the funky difference of this hotel, it isn't like your average place and the location is perfect. The decor is art deco and the smaller size makes it feel more comfortable. One of the most memorable things to me is how clean the rooms always smell. So fresh, I want to know what they use to clean or wash sheets with because it smells so good I instantly relax. I've heard alot about the noise in the hotel and I can't honestly remember ever being bothered by it, however, it does have 2 event spaces for weddings and other party events so I can understand the noise. It won't stop me from visiting again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Suited all my needs”
Reviews.Author: jay1974usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited all my needs. I was there for a conference for 2 nights. The room had everything I needed, although a mini fridge would have been nice. Smaller hotel (only about 65 rooms) had a nice feel to it. Staff was very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jennyjenanders
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter to Baltimore this last weekend to celebrate her 3rd birthday and we stayed at Pier 5. My husband and I were extremely disappointed with the hotel. I had asked for an early check in and when we arrived at 1pm, we were told the room was "almost" ready, we could leave our bags, and they would call me on my cell phone when the room was ready. When we returned to the hotel at 5pm, I still had not received a call stating my room was ready. We got back to the hotel and the front desk stated the room was ready and they “forgot” to call me. I should mention that the couple in front of us received a room with a bed not fully made because the pillowcases were not finished washing (its 5pm – most hotels have the rooms ready by 3pm) so I’m not sure when the room actually became ready. We got up to our room and were sure we had the wrong room. I had been excited because I believed we were getting a two room suite. I had ordered the Grand Clause Sleeping room believing from the website that this was the Grand Clause Suite but the front desk informed me when I came downstairs that I had the correct room and that the Grand Clause Sleeping Room was in fact a Traditional King room. What I can’t figure out is why they have two options when selecting your room on the website – The grand clause sleeping room and the traditional king to pick from and why the description isn’t clearer. The website was misleading and it was not clear that the Grand Clause Suite and the Grand Clause Sleeping room were “different”. There were three of us and we definitely would not have stayed at this hotel or ordered a traditional king sized room if we had known that the Grand Clause Sleeping room was the same as a traditional king room – we thought we were getting a suite. Needless to say the front desk people did not care and had no other options for us even though there was practically no-one staying there. They stated the manager on duty would call me the next day (why not right then to discuss) which he or she did not. To date, I have not been contacted. My husband and I wanted to make the best of it so we were going to try to enjoy our night there but the hotel just sucked. The vending machines were out of soda and when I asked about room service (they have two connected restaurants), I was told they don’t use either one and that I could order form Mo’s Restaurant but I needed a $30 minimum order in order for them to deliver to my room. I would have been much happier staying at the Renaissance Harborplace hotel and would have if I had known more. At least we would have had two beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastnewbie
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I went to Baltimore for a quick 10 year anniversary celebration. As a surprise my husband booked the Godiva Getaway at the PIER V Hotel. We just used the hotel as a place to sleep and it served it's purpose well. Check -in went smoothly, in fact, the man checked us in while we tried to figure out how to get the car valet parked. when we came inside we were all checked in! Wonderful! Our room was on the second floor, very clean. Our box of Godiva chocolates, chocolate covered strawberries and love song CD were waiting for us. Room was updated nicely with a flat screen TV, very boutique atmosphere, bathroom very clean although the ceiling in the shower is waterstained. Check out was equally as smooth and pleasant, vey sweet staff, checked our bags for the morning so that we could enjoy Baltimoe before heading home. Drawbacks- VALET PARKING had difficulty figuring out where the valet person was in order to get our car parked and to have our car returned. NOISE! thin walls and spent most of the time wondering if our balcony window was closed because everytime someone talked it sounded like they were in our room.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nicer stay than expected”
Reviews.Author: nickylove
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mid week trip to the Inner harbor. Booked at the Pier 5, though nervous after reading other reviews. The Lobby was very Art Deco, but not at all offensive and the person at the front desk was very nice. We had a late checkin, but our room was ready, and we had booked a special Sam Adams package, which in included some beer, glasses,bottle opener and other items, which were waiting in our room. We had a king room overlooking the Harbor, and though basic, it was very nice. I will agree that the sound insulation could be better, but we really only heard people open and closing their doors, No voices or anything. We had dinner downstairs at Mc. & Schmicks, and that was very nice as well. The food was excellent, even if a bit pricey. The hotel was also great with a courtesy late check out. Overall a good stay, and a wonderful location. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, enjoyed the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccweezie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. I was nervous after reading some reviews that said the hotel was in disrepair, etc. but we were pleasantly surprised. I booked a one night wine package over the phone with the hotel. After I called I saw on their website that there was a promotion for a $25 gas card if you booked a package. The agent added it to my res. I also inquired about free parking for harbor magic members (I joined online) and she said I could not get that b/c I was getting the gas card. I said fine but when we checked in I asked again regarding free parking and the front desk agent gave it to us happily, they also gave us the gas card and a $50 voucher toward our next stay. We were upgraded to a suite b/c the hotel was sold out. Room was very nice, walls are thin so you hear a lot of doors slamming but that was just in the morning. A/C was also rather loud but not awful. Great location, didn't have to take the car out at all and had a really nice dinner at Sabatinos in Little Italy. I'd go back to Pier 5 again, staff was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SnowAngel21
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect in the Inner Harbor. I was only there for 1 night so I did not get to experience as much as I wanted. It is walkable to the PP entertainment complex and the shops and restaurants in the Inner Harbor. The hotel has 2 great restaurants--Ruth's Chris and McCormick & Schmicks--where you do not even need to venture to the waterfront. The rooms were decorated uniquely...not your standard hotel room look. Staff were very pleasant and helpful to restaurant recommendations in the harbor. The staff also invited me to a crab event that they hold nightly in the lobby. I didn't get to enjoy it on this trip, but other guests looked like they were having a great time. Overall, I had a good experience...room was clean, staff was friendly and location was perfect...that is all I need.

Reviews.Title: “My experience was fairly nice”
Reviews.Author: Sweettooth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night, September 25th, and overall my experience with the hotel was good. I booked online with the 14 Day Advanced HM Magic Package. Others have written that there was an activity fee and things that you don't get when reserving online and that was what I got. Though they let you know this when you check in. Others have written that when checking in that the front desk doesn't seem to know that you even had a reservation with them. I faced the same thing, but they had no problem putting the reservation in right there and then. I was in room 208. This was a two double bed room with a view. When I reserved online, they had asked if I had any requests that they couldn't guarentee, but would try to get for me. I had requested a balcony and got the request. I have posted pictures of the room. Others also have written that the walls are paper thin and they are correct. My room had a door that I would assume that they use as a connecting room type of thing, but for me wasn't necessary and was kept locked. I did have people in the next room that I could hear their conversations as well I'm sure they could hear mine. I would definitely suggest that the hotel do something about that. You needed a security card to get to your floor and room. I also stayed at the Peabody for a night and while with the Peabody the card you used was needed for the elevator, at the Pier V hotel you need it for your floor. There are doors on your floor that you need to go through to get to your room. The only way to access the door is through a security key. This was fine for me. I had a view directly across from the Aquarium. They did offer the crab event that others have mentioned, but unfortunately I did not have the time to take the offer. The hotel sent me a survey, that I intend to fill out, via my email. They asked if everything was alright. I had visitors who were coming to visit that did not know which room I was in. I had the front desk call my room if they asked for me. I had pizza delivery. Any services or questions that I had were taken care of. It wasn't a ritzy hotel with pampering and fluff, but it was a nice hotel. I am familiar with the Baltimore area and grew up in and around the area. It is located conveniently right by the water on the Aquarium, Little Italy, Fells Point, Canton, etc. side of the Inner Harbor. It is a little farther away from the ballpark/stadium side of the Inner Harbor. Though the hotel does offer valet parking, I knew I was going to be using my car frequently so I parked at the Pier V parking garage that is next door to the hotel. It would be cheaper for those who are not parking their car there for long or overnight. It was also convenient because the garage has a system that you can access your car at any time of the day or night. There are some garages that close and you are not able to access your vehicle until the next day when they open. I had not written this before, but when I lived in Baltimore I would take trips out of state and leave my car parked in a garage. On one of these trips I needed to get a cab to a bus terminal. It was raining and too early in the morning to flag down a cab around town so I happen to walk by the Pier V hotel. They had someone working out in front of the hotel and I asked if it would be alright if I could get them to call me a cab. They did and even let me wait in the lobby for it. It saved me a tedious trek around to find a place where I could find a taxi at that time of the morning and was amazing to me that they would even bother especially since I was not a guest staying at the hotel at the time. That one brief experience truely made me feel the kind of quality that this hotel held.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, loud, loud!”
Reviews.Author: J_and_N_in_FL
Reviews.Content: Their property is goregous, but they need some serious sound insulation. We heard when the restaurants downstairs closed and when the party upstairs let out. The revelers all flowed into the central atrium to continue their conversations and good times really late at night. You expect big city noises when staying in the heart of the city, but the dumpster being emptied at 3:30 a.m. did nothing to help the night's sleep. Nor did the "amorous" relations of the couple next door to us around 4:00 a.m. Maybe the dumpster woke them up? Anyhow, I can't think of a worse night's sleep - even as I write this review nearly three years later!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: jiwdurando
Reviews.Content: This place is not a Five Star Hotel. When we arrived we had to wait fifteen minutes before anyone checked us in, and it wasnt because alot of people were checking in, the guy was on the phone with a personal phone call. After we finally checked in, the gentleman forgot to explain that we needed our key cards to get to the third floor, there is a sign in the elevator but its small and easily missed, well we ended up having to ask and the gentleman made us feel very stupid like we should have seen that. Our rooms were ok, but not five star material, the free breakfast wasnt very good either, the only thing i would suggest this place for was location, its really close to power plant live, but i wouldnt pay for this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Family extremely diappointed.”
Reviews.Author: patrick1960
Reviews.Content: Web site noted room service. None at all. Upon arrival, advised check in within 1/2 hour, due to cleaning. 4 hours later (luggage could not be checked in-so we had to remain in lobby and and hold) advised room finally cleaned and ready. We noted many later arrivals who were checked in. For a 4 hour cleaning this room, it had a dirty tub (looked like animal hairs) dirty sink and the smell in main room was undescribable. Air conditioning did not work. Account Access was not available (site kept showing available later). Extremely disappointed/put a damper on whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: LindersPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was next to the hotel my conference was at. The only good thing I can say is that the staff was nice and the bedding was clean. On the bad side, the walls are thin, music is playing loudly outside on a veranda (past 11pm), overall furniture & carpeting is old/stained and there are several areas under construction/remodel. They also have the loudest airconditioning unit I have ever experienced. This hotel is nowhere near classy enough to call itself a boutique hotel. No "harbor magic" felt here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mutiger97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Pier 5 Hotel. We booked through Priceline for $90 a night and felt it was well worth the price. The location was excellent - right on the Inner Harbor and close to the Baltimore Aquarium, Camden Yards, and the local areas of interest (Little Italy, Fells Point). The room was nice and quiet. They even had a complimentary 'crabby hour' each night where a snack was made and wine/beer was provided. My only complaint was the $9.95 activity fee that was charged for each night stayed. I wasn't aware of the fee before we checked in. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and BIG disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kristin79
Reviews.Content: Technically, we didn't 'Stay' at the hotel as we left shortly after checking in. For a property to bill themselves as a boutique hotel and charge boutique hotel prices, we expected much more. The lobby itself at first glance is nice but closer inspection reveals obvious neglect. Noticeable chips in the walls and woodwork, dirt on the floor, etc. were the first things we noticed. After checking into our $300/night basic room, we noticed a huge scuff mark on the armoire, paint peeling off the bathroom doors, and other obvious signs of a lack of quality control and regular room visits by the hotel staff and management. Thankfully, the management was understanding and we left with a full credit. It was the nicest part of the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Magical Package NOT so Magical”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel conveniently located right next to the National Aquarium and Inner Harbor. Booked a Harbor Magical Package that included Hotel Room, Breakfast and Tickets to the Aquarium. Package price was actually MORE EXPENSIVE than if we booked through Travelocity or Expedia, and purchased our Aquarium tickets directly online. Aquarium tickets also did not include the Immersion 4D movie which had to be purchased separately. The experience specialist only works 10am-5pm and was not working during the day of our visit. Hotel front desk and concierge provides the same services. Breakfast was ok, comfortable bed, clean room, nice decor. Seems like Harbor Magical Package reserves the smallest rooms in the hotel. Non smoking room was directly above smoking rooms with balcony, making the nice view and sliding glass door useless. Will stay at the Marriott or Intercontinental (also right on the Inner Harbor) next trip for less!

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip, but be forewarned....”
Reviews.Author: muff2468
Reviews.Content: My husband, two small children, and I stayed at the Pier V recently as part of the Harbor Magic, Spring Break Getaway package. The package included 2-3 night stay, 8 breakfast passes to the hotel restaurant, and 3 tickets to the Port Discovery Childrens Museum. Here are my thoughts.... Hotel-- First, the hotel was clean and comfortable and has a evry interesting look, and the staff was very helpful and accomodating. They had a nice crabby hour where you can sample a nice crab dip and have wine, beer or soda. My complaints were 1) that our tv remote didnt work,and we called 3 times to ask that someone fix it, but it was not addressed until the last night of our stay. 2) the cleaning service was not good, ie we would see wrappers/debris still scattered on the floor after the room was "cleaned"., 3) the room we were given only had one bed, EVEN THOUGH WE TOLD THEM WE WERE A FAMILY OF FOUR AND WANTED TWO DOUBLES. (After complaining at the front desk, they bought in an air mattress but I was still kind of irritated by this. The kids were fine with it though). BE FOREWARNED: there are big $$$ tax and occumpacy fees. We payed nearly $60 on tax and fees PER NIGHT..Ask about the costs of these to avoid any unpleasnt surprises...Plus PARKING IS $21 PER DAY. No free parking options available. Factor this into your budget. Hotel Breakfast passes -- The food was good, the service, not so good. On day one, there was s a long wait because the place seems understaffed. The next day, it was better, no doubt because of complaints. BE FOREWARNED: Go early (before 9) or expect a good wait. Activities-- The package came with 3 museum tickets. Ypu can buy extra tix in advance. The kids had a nice time (they are 8 and 5), but they were only entertained for about 2 hours. They loved the jungle gym - that's the main attraction.The rest was not that interesting too them.... We also purchased (in advance) tickets to the Acquarium. This was a bit of a disappointment. BE FOREWARNED: The 3D showed scared my children. If you have small children, SIT NEAR THE AISLE SO YOU CAN LEAVE EARLY IF NEEDED. The dolphin show was nice but over so fast you hardly felt you saw any tricks. GET THERE AT LEAST 15 minutes early if you want a good seat. Also, if you go to the acquarium on a Saturday, there is a long line, so if you are sure you want to go, buy tix in advance to avoid the line.). Lastly, we also purchased (in advance) ESPN zone tickets. This was okay as well, but really the games are geared to older kids than mine so we didnt get much benefit out of it. BE FOREWARNED: DONT buy tix in advance because they are pretty easy to get once you are there, and if you dont use them they are NOT refundable. Overall, nice trip, but much more pricey than the benefits we received. I can say Ive been to the Harbor, but not likely to go back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, No Amenities”
Reviews.Author: readridinghood
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel for business travelers. There is no concierge, no business center (except a computer and printer in the lobby), no pool, no exercise equipment. The room service was the worst - there isn't anything on-site. You need to call a local seafood restaurant with a very limited menu that was delivered to my room by a rude kid who basically shoved a bag at me and left. The food was bad and they charged me $2.50 for a Diet Coke which consisted of about 1/2 cup of beverage served in a styrofoam soup container. The room phones are not marked with the usual room service, main desk, wake up call, etc. If you dial "O" the phone rings a very long time and several times I just gave up. My husband called the hotel to reach me and said that they never picked up the phone so he gave up and left a message on my cell phone. On the good side - the bed and pillows were comfortable and the room was reasonably clean and in decent shape.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Good... Feels Bad”
Reviews.Author: b0nefish
Reviews.Content: I'm a management consultant and do a ton of travelling for business. We usually stay in 4 star hotels and I don't consider myself abnormally picky about hotels. I simply expect a clean, comfortable, quiet room with a good bed and internet access for the 4-star price point. A client arranged for us to stay for a few nights at the Pier V hotel last week and, in all candor, I was pretty disappointed. The Good: The location is great and very convenient to the inner harbor and downtown areas. McCormick & Schmicks and a Ruths Chris steakhouse are on the property. No issues with getting a bite to eat or a drink. There is a Panera about 2 blocks away and has great Breakfast and Lunch options. The Bad: The rooms, although painted and decorated in a funky modern motif, were crappy. I had a stack of dirty room service dishes outside my door for an entire day. The wooden furniture in my room was really beaten up. The carpet was stained and torn in a couple of places. The tile floors in the bathroom were dirty and the grout in the shower was mildewy. The pillows on the bed were worn out and, after a few hours, felt like I was sleeping on a bag of rocks. $30/night for "valet" service parking your car in a pay lot next to the hotel... both times I needed my car, I had to go searching for the parking attendant as he did not answer the phone and was not at the front door. Most troubling, however, was the noise and lack of privacy between rooms. The lock-off doors between rooms allowed for a TON of noise to permeate between the rooms. To put it plainly, you can hear **everything** that is going on in the room next to yours. On the first night, I endured 3 1/2 hours of banter between a drunken couple who came in at 1:00am. The following night, I was serenaded by a tuneful snorer and phlem clearer! Needless to say, I hardly slept either night and could not wait to get to out of there. Bottom Line: Great location if you are needing to be in the Inner Harbor area. For the price, you can find much better accomodation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience at Pier 5”
Reviews.Author: shellgilardi
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Pier 5 and had a great time. The location is excellent and the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. There is so much to do in that area around the hotel that we never had to take a taxi. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The crab and wine tasting every evening was a very nice touch. Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edith2000
Reviews.Content: My husband just returned from an stay at Pier 5 and have nothing but good things to say about our experience there. This trip to B-more was for a birthday celebration. We stayed three days. The attention to detail was evident from the start. Check in was effortless. The staff courteous and accommodating. Our room was comfortable, clean, and the location was ideal for exploring the Inner Harbor area, every thing was within walking distance. We had booked the Ultimate package and had several extras ordered to make my birthday celebration extra special. The Pier 5 did not disappoint. We were so happy with our stay we will definitely book there again. In fact we are returning to B-more in October for the Fells Point festival and will be staying at Pier 5's sister hotel the Admiral Fell Inn based on our experience with Pier 5 we expect to have a great experence there also.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money and 80 dollars in taxes and fees”
Reviews.Author: colormetravel
Reviews.Content: For the price for one evening (354 + 80 dollars in added fees) the shower curtain had mold, the bathroom rug had mold and there were cobwebs. Room service plates were outside our room from the time we arrived and still there when we left. Beer bottles and trash were left in the lobby for more than 30 hours. Sparse staff..only positive experience was the staff in the breakfast cafe'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel + Great City = Great fun”
Reviews.Author: jjs572003
Reviews.Content: Just want to let everyone know that this is a great hotel. I stayed during the memorial day holiday to make it a nice holiday/birthday weekend with my girlfriend and what a great gift it was. I got the passes to the aquarium as well as flowers and cake in the room for the girly and it was great - she loved it all. The front desk/staff is incredibly nice and helpful and the Crabby Hour/Chocolate events were awesome. Jill, the experienced specialist, was incredible as well. Being that close to everything and having a great place to stay with nice people is not something you could put a price on.... oh, lets not forget the awesome view with the balcony!!! Loved it and will be going back... this time with the pug. Enjoy, it's well worth it! JS

Reviews.Title: “Overall stay good...”
Reviews.Author: destinationunkwn
Reviews.Content: The overall hotel itself was not bad. I was not crazy about the wild wall colors but who cares i was only staying one night. The bed was good, nothing spectacular. We did have a issue checking in. When we arrived they had us down for there sister hotel nearby instead of Pier 5 (luckily we had our confirmation with us!). Anyway, they found us a room at the hotel, we did have to wait for it to be cleaned but I was happy they made a effort to get it straight. The customer service was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: golemlee
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for a work conference. Rooms are clean- no issue there- but I found the staff less than helpful in general, and very little in the way of amenities. For example, no gift shop to buy toiletries, etc., no room service. Also, the "internet" wasn't working for 2 nights- even though the hotel charges an extra $9.95 to cover this and phone calls.... The place was not horrible- but I wouldn't rush back at all.....

Reviews.Title: “pier 5 customer care”
Reviews.Author: onehappyguest
Reviews.Content: we spent a weekend at this hotel. our VALET parked car was broken into. this fine hotel pushed us to the parking lot company for answers. the good part about this is paying $31.00 a day for valet parking and not knowing someone else has your car. our car was parked in a gated parking lot with 24 hour guards and after the $1700.00 break in occurred we received a letter stating that since this was a premediated act they were not responsible for anything. i will let as many people as i can know about this customer care policy. thanks pier 5 hotel, baltimore inner harbor, wfoster

Reviews.Title: “Everything...... including a mouse.”
Reviews.Author: gccc44
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Right next to the Aquarium and within a 4 minute walk to the shops and restaurants of the Inner Harbor. Also, a close walk to Little Italy where there are great restaurants. The decor of the hotel is okay... they try to be hip modern and it's not too bad. Room was fine. I would not recommend this hotel if you can find someplace else. Here's why: First, they tout their "complimentary" In-Hotel activities that you are charged $10 per night for. Someone ought to give them a dictionary and show them that the word "complimentary" means "costing nothing". You are charged a fee for phone and internet use even though you don't use the phone. Go figure. We came back to our room one day around 4pm and noticed that we didn't have bath towels.... they said we had to wait until they came out of the laundry. You think maybe they'd have enough towels to have one handy when you want to take a shower. So, that took a while to get towels when we really wanted to shower. Little things like not replacing the empty tissue box. Also, a little thing like a mouse that scampered into the room on the last morning. (I think they charged us for it, too). There is no gym or workout room. But we were told that the sister hotel several blocks away had a gym that we were welcome to use. I'm surprised they didn't send us to the Marriot to use the toilets there. Possibly the worst part was every night of the weekend, there was a large party taking place in the lobby and side rooms. One was a wedding party, the next night it was some Hindu wedding with loud music and the next night it was a black fashion show..... complete with thumping, loud music until 11pm. On the day we left, we had to get a cab to the airport at 5:30am so we asked for a wake-up call that never came. Fortunately, we set our own alarm clock or else we probably would have missed our flight. Had enough? I wouldn't necessarily say that your stay here would be horrible, but for the money, I'd rather have more towels and less mice. An excercise room would be a plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trav16
Reviews.Content: We stayed one Sat night at this hotel as a anniv getaway to the Inner Harbor. The location is great - on the water right next to the Nat'l Aquarium within walking distance of most attractions, restaurants and shopping. The hotel is nice looking and clean. Our room on the 3rd floor was huge and had vaulted ceilings and a comfy bed. The bathroom was also large with a good shower and counter space. Our room rate included breakfast which was delicious. We booked the Nat'l Aquarium package and it was well worth it to received the special voucher that let us walk past the long lines to the member services entrance where we could go in without receiving an entrance timed ticket. There were a few minor things that were not so wonderful. The hotel allows pets and during the chocolate fourtain hour there was a dog jumping all over the lobby couches. Valets were no where to be seen when we arrived and we ended up parking the car ourselves. (Costs 21.00 for self parking) I also didn't like being charged the mandatory 10.00 "destination" fee that was only noted after I made the reservation. The charge was for internet, shuttle and phone calls that many hotels offer at no charge. Add'l we were in a "city view" room that actually faced the water but it also overlooked a roof with some nasty hotel equipment. Overall though we did enjoy our time at this hotel and do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: cmb_rocks
Reviews.Content: The location of Pier 5 is perfect for getting around the Inner Harbor area by foot. You are within walking distance of Fells Point, Little Italy, Power Plant Live, Federal Hill and of course the Aquarium. My Fiancee and I had a room with a king size bed and a balcony overlooking the Harbor. The air conditioner in the room was extremely loud. So much so, we had to turn off the A/C to hear the TV without blaring the volume. Judging from the volume of TVs we could hear from adjoining rooms and in the hallway, we were not alone. The layout of the room was a little awkward with a chair blocking the entrance to the balcony. This chair had a large stain on the seat and we couldn't believe they wouldn't have had it cleaned or replaced. There is only one ice machine for three floors and it was not working. When I reported this to the front desk, I was told it had been broken for "a while" and they would send ice up to our room right away. A long fifteen minutes later, we had ice. The front desk were friendly during check-in, but after wards seemed not as friendly and gave us the impression we were bothering them. Overall we were disappointed and will not be staying there again since it is definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Still Waiting for the Magic”
Reviews.Author: sbtold1
Reviews.Content: This hotel came recommended to us by friends as a site for a weekend anniversary getaway and, after reading the other reviews and visiting their website, it did seem ideal. We were greated warmly and provided with our room two hours before the published check-in time. We were impressed with the fact that the hallway to our room was accessible only by the room key, limiting hallway foot traffic. The hotel location was wonderful. Short walks (15 - 20 minutes at a reasonable pace) to the Inner Harbor shops and restaurants and to the Power Plant Live entertainment complex. The complimentary shuttle between the Pier 5 and the Admiral Fell Inn was also appreciated. The rooms were large and nicely furnished and the bed was quite comfortable, although the wallpaper in our bathroom was peeling and in need of scrubbing. Be advised that the pictures of the hotel exterior suggests that there are small terraces off some of the rooms; we had one such room and realized it was not a small terrace but simply a decorative iron rail to keep one from falling out when opening the patio door. It was nice, though, to open the door and hear the sights and sounds of the harbor while we were in the room. All of the good, unfortunately, was overshadowed by the problems we experienced. The website advertised a promotional offer for a $20 gas card but, upon inquiring at the hotel, we were told that that offer had expired before we even made our reservation. We had also signed up for free membership in the Harbor Magic Club, advertised on their web site, prior to reserving our room. The membership entitles us to a $50 voucher to be used for a future visit. It has been six weeks since our stay and I have not yet received this voucher; I sent email a few days ago but have not yet had a response. These two perks, valued at $70, were a contributing factor in our decision to stay at the Pier 5 rather than the Renaissance, where we have stayed in the past and highly recommend. Most frustrating, though, was an experience similar to that experienced by the writer who stayed here the weekend of the Miss USA pageant. NOISE!!! A bat mitzvah was being held in a banquet facility located off the lobby and, as the other writer noted, the event spilled over into the lobby. The doors to the banquet facility were left open and we could hear not only the music but also the shrieks and squeals of teenagers as if they were right outside our door - which, truth be told, they almost were since the hallway outside our room looked directly into the lobby. This was certainly not an environment conducive to an anniversary getaway. The event ended shortly after midnight - about two hours later than one would think reasonable given the inadequate accommodations for such an event. I did receive an apology when I inquired at the desk as to the scheduled end of the event, although it was given in such a way that I am quite certain I was not the only guest to receive one that evening. I did not, though, receive what I feel would have been a more appropriate 'Harbor Magic' gesture, though - like complimentary drink vouchers we could have used when we left and waited it out at a nearby bar. I received an emailed survey after our visit, inquiring as to the satisfaction of our stay. I responded with a similar level of detail to that which I post here but, again, no response at all. I would be happy to give the Pier 5 another chance (although not for an anniversary getaway) - if, that is, I receive the expected $20 gas card and $50 future visit voucher. Otherwise, we will be taking our business back to the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed by the details”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rm 208 of Pier 5 on the 24th of June. I walked in to a beautiful three story atrium- which was leaking into a trash can surrounded by mop buckets. I was a little early for check in so I left my baggage with the desk who said they would call when the room was ready, which they did 48 minutes past check in time. I had to use the restroom before I went up to my room, so I went to the one in the lobby. It was the most beautiful and stylish restroom I have ever seen, except for the overflowing trash bin and the paper towels and toilet paper scattered around the floor. I went upstairs to my room where the atrium has beautiful sail like awnings hanging from the ceiling- which were covered by dust and trash when viewed from above.I went into my room which had a beautiful armoir which hides the tv and fridge.I tried to close the doors to find one completly broken off its' hinges the other stuck in place and the lower two mismatched by over an inch, hanging out of alignment. I opened the lower two to find a handy fridge- with the freezer completly frozen over with ice. I walked over to the bathroom to put on some lovely coffee that was provided only to have the broken coffee basket fall into the sink. I sat down at the lovely desk only to notice the veneer had been ripped off the legs and replaced with duct tape- nice.There were beautiful black laquered beds, which were missing huge chunks of the veneer at each corner. There were stylish mirrored light switches on the headboards- which showed every fingerprint of the previous guests and turned on in the oppisite directions. I would have filled out the handy comments card which three were provided, but no pen was provided and when I asked for one at the front desk I was told they didn't have one. This place was probably beautiful when it was built, but now it is shabby and not worth half of what you will pay for crappy service and a well worn room.

Reviews.Title: “Felt The Magic...”
Reviews.Author: earthwitch
Reviews.Content: We had a girls weekend in Baltimore, the weekend of the Miss USA pagent, unbenownst to us. It turned out that we booked this hotel because it was the only one that had rooms. Boy were we more than pleasantly surprised! The decor is gorgeous- if you appreciate bright and modern as we do. The staff always went above and beyond. We flew in early and were able to check in to our room at 9:30 AM! Amazing! We were expecting to have to store our luggage! We had a double queen room. The beds were wonderful! Warning to those staying for more than a day or two...THERE ARE NO DRESSERS. The closet was a bit small, but the room was huge! There was a desk in our room, in between the beds instead of a nightstand. They provide a fridge (not stocked), hairdryer, toiletries are good, and even umbrellas for the days it rains. (And not those chintzy ones either, the large ones with the nice walking handle that hooks over your arm!) The room was impeccably clean. IF YOU NEED TO GET TO SLEEP BEFORE MIDNIGHT ON A WEEKEND, YOU WILL WANT TO STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE. The main atrium, which all the rooms front, is also spillover for parties and wedding receptions in the banquet rooms below. The loud music does float up, even though the soundproofing is good. The roof of the atrium is glass, so when it rains hard, they get a few leaks in the lobby. There are three eateries attached, a breakfast/lunch cafe with okay food but wonderful staff, a seafood place which was FABULOUS, and a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. They are currently offering an aquarium VIP package- only pay extra for this if you will be going to the aquarium on the weekend. Without it, you WILL have to stand in line, and will be given a time to COME BACK to get in. The aquarium is VERY popular on weekends! There's virtually no lines on weekdays however, except for holidays. There are several cute and comfy couches in the lobby for meeting and talking with people, as long as there isn't a reception. The hotel is the next pier over from the mammal pavillion of the aquarium, and our room looked right into the dolphin theatre! There were a few glitches, but I honestly was highly impressed by this gem of a hotel. Alot of these large boutique hotels lose their special feel. That was not my experience at Pier 5. I will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel, but they need to chill on the "magic"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean rooms, and a great value. The staff is pleasant, but they just beat the "magic" thing into you until you can't take it anymore. Everyone asks you how they could create "magic" for you... Well you know, making food appear it my room after midnight would have been "magical..." That is a small nit-pick item though. Rooms were really clean and nice, and the bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Had to write in!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is interesting that you write this about the Pier 5. I was there in February and did not get a chance to write a review but now that I saw the review about the ship and the crab thing had to write in as well. This is a great hotel and very unique. not another one like it in Baltimore. I stayed there on business and will definately bring my wife back for a weekend. so close to everything. the other great thing about this hotel is they hve two other hotels they work with - I think the Brookshire Suites and the Admiral Fell Inn. Both cool, fun hotels. They actually invite you to things that go on at those hotels too. me and a friend tried out the Brew at the Brook - if i am saying this right- where you can eat and drink all the beer you want in the early evening. cool places, great service, just what you want in a city like Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one weekend and the hotel was overall ok, nothing special. When we arrived, there was one valet outside and the wait was 20 min. We ended up carrying everything upstairs by ourselves and parking our own car. There was one woman at the front desk and the wait was ~15 min just to check in. The room was decent and included a balcony that overlooked the harbor. The room was supposedly "harbor view" but on one side there was a roof occluding half of the view of the harbor and right next door were people's rooms that you could see right in to! This was not very private to say the least! We had one incident of someone walking right into our room with us in it! The heat was great and the bed was very comfortable. The tv/movies were a rip off and should not be advertised as "on demand" if you have to pay $12 just to see a movie. The hotel overcharged me and am still in the process of working this out. One perk of the hotel is the location is excellent - close to everything! All in all, I do not think I would stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DebnJayGoSox
Reviews.Content: Pier 5 was a nice boutique hotel, decor was very contemporay,nice, but not my cup of tea. I was in room 335. the king bed was very very comfy. Very large room, very large bathroom. Not enough towels, and the tub drained ever so slow, i was up to my ankles in water while taking a shower. Every thing was clean. One thing the room needed was a dresser, there was no place to lay your clothes out so i had to use the chair and keep my incidentals in my suitcase. They did have a closet but i think it had 3 hangers. Check-in time is 4, but my husband and I arrived at 12:30 because I knew they would keep our luggage til check-in while we went around the inner harbor to explore. We arrived by taxi from the airport. But surprize our room was all set and they let us check-in. Staff and front desk were very pleasant and always said good morning on your way by the desk. They took the internet fee of $5.00 per day off the bill when asked. Just ask in a nice way, being rude doesn't get you any where. We stayed for 3 nights and had the contenatial breakfast each morning, it was more than enough food and very good. A very large bagel, a muffin and a lot of fresh fruit. There was slices of banana, strawberry, grapes, melon and raspberries, more than enough, plus butter, cream cheese and jelly. Oh, plenty of juice and coffee too. The hotels restaurant is the peacock cafe, we didn't eat any other meals there. They have function rooms and there were 5 wedding receptions there on our 3 night stay. You can't hear the music in your room. The AC worked great, we like a very cool room to sleep, I think it was about 55 or 60 degrees. There are 2 restaurants at the hotel, but are not part of the hotel, both very expensive. One was Ruth Chris steakhouse, a filet migeon will be 35.00, T-bone $38.00 and potatoe is 5.95 and veggie is 5.95, yes, salad is extra too. Dessert will run at 8 bucks and a martini is $9.50. It was packed all 3 nights of our stay. The other eatery is McCormick and Shmicks, very busy place big on seafood there and also very very expensive. The hotel itself is tucked off right on a pier and it's quiet. Would we stay here again? probably, if I'm ever in Baltimore again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the right price”
Reviews.Author: moretosee
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 is at a great location for Inner Harbor activities. I got a great deal via Priceline, but Priceline rates it as a 4 star, which doesn't seem right. A nice hotel, friendly staff, clean, large rooms, and comfortable beds. The mandatory fee for phone and internet seems unreasonable if you don't use either, especially the internet, but maybe the hotel just needs better marketing. Charging a fee for for the room phone is like charging for the cable on the TV. I saw the reaction form many guests, it doesn't make sense to put guests on the defensice when they check-in. I would stay there again if I were enjoying the Inner Harbor or going to a ball game.

Reviews.Title: “Love Pier 5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to getaway mid week to go to Baltimore and see a concert at Rams Head Live in mid-July. We splurged and stayed at the Pier 5 Hotel. The hotel is absolutly gorgeous! The staff were extremely friendly. The room was AMAZING! It was so very modern, the color sceme in our room was gold and purple, and even the bathroom was gorgeous -much different than your typical hotel bathroom. The bed was very, very comfortable as were the couch and chair. I wanted to take the chair home with us! Avoid eating at the hotel's cafe. The breakfast there was awful. Don't bother purchasing a package deal either with the hotel. It's not worth the extra money and I found the breakfast coupons to be a total waste of money since no food was really offered with them. If you want to splurge stay here. We probably won't stay there again because it was very expensive for our means, but worth the night we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go in the summer!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRed75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 17th for a show to see Richard Marx. The check in was "supposed" to be at 4:30... When we arrived though, we got there early. We walked around for a while, got something to eat and returned. Went back up to the counter at 4:30 and the room was STILL not ready... I don't think it was ready till close to 5PM! Could have even been a few minutes after... So... we get into our room, the little balcony that we did have (which was about a foot maybe). Cigarettes butts all over the balcony. The view was of the Harbor side, but there was the roof from the floor below which kind of obstructed what would have been a nice view. The air conditioner didn't work to save our lives. I guess because it was above 80 degrees and the compressor had to work too hard, so the room was quite warm, while the lobby was freezing cold. On the other hand though, the people at the front desk were very personable and courteous. Check-in process was fast, once the room was available. The other downfall is considering the price for the room for one night, the parking should be free... this is not the case. The parking was $25.00 I believe... Not sure I would stay here again. Maybe not that particular room, and surely not in the summer...

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Baltimore for an overnight stay, and we invited friends to join us. I had stayed at the Pier V a few years prior and I was anxious to return. On the plus side, the location is awesome and the 2nd floor rooms provide an excellent view of the harbor (unless of course you book a city view). There is a nightclub (not open when we were there but perhaps that is because it was a Sunday night), a nice restaurant (McCormick and Schmick's), and a coffee/liquor bar which served breakfast. Unfortunately, I had to send a letter to the hotel management. The balconies were dirty when we checked in (cigarette butts all over the ground and an empty pepsi bottle sitting on the table), my friend's room did not have a lock on the sliding glass door and our sliding glass door lock was broken. Our toilet seat was broken as well and when we ran out of toilet paper (after 2 hours????????) there were no refills in the bathroom. My friend found a wet towel mat wrapped around a wet box of soap under her TV and conspicuous hairs in the shower stalls. EWWW! I was hoping to impress my friends, but I think they were very unimpressed, to say the least!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
Reviews.Content: I really do not understand the lukewarm reviews about this hotel. Our Pier V stay was very pleasant and above average. The hotel is located right at the Inner Harbor close to the Aquarium and Inner Harbor sites and entertainment. It is just a brief walk to the historic district of Fells Point and Little Italy restaurants. If you are going for a football or baseball game there are closer hotels to those venues. I booked the room through the hotel's own website and for high season in the summer for the property got a good value at $179 per night compared to other hotels in the area. We were promptly greated by the valet and bellman. The check in procedures were fine except a 4:30 pm check in is way too late. The hotel is decorated in a trendy fashion with large clean rooms with comfortable bedding and nice amenitites. We had a city view room, but still have a water view on our balcony that faced a coast guard ship docked at the next pier. There was a complementary chocolate fondue party at 5:30 pm. Breakfast the next morning in the hotel's cafe was delicious. Enjoy yourself at the Pier V!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Made reservations online, only nice thing about the trip was the harbor pass. The hotel is non smoking, very much needed, we have a daughter with special needs and respitory problems. Walked into the room and smelled cig. smoke. Told the front desk, the room was aired out and respaced the filter. The smell was gone but I worried about the air quality. THe view was not good, balconies are bars on the sliding glass door. Not a balcony in my book. The room was dirty, rug was stained, not vacuumed either. The bathroom was dirty, tub had pink growth around drain, bottom had a slip guard thing which had black dirt marks, needed to be replaced, floor was dirty in bathroom even had someone elses pubic hair, yuk. It was very hard to wash my girls and just felt gross. The hallway had a leak in the ceiling dripping down most of the day, next morning still dripping tried to walk around with flip-flops on, the carpet was sooo wet , my feet got wet, gross. The room was large which was nice but with the other problems just was not worth the money and really put a damper on our vacation. First time on a vacation that arriving home to a clean bathroom made me appreciate being home. Just not worth the $$$ for this hotel. Oh we booked thru myleisuretravel.com. The staff was nice but didn't seem like they had to much control over the facility. Nothing magical about this vacation, extra fees they don't tell you about get tacked on too, connective fee we never even used but everyone must pay. Oh and two of the resturants on different days had the air condition out. Not good in 90 degree weather. If we ever go again, we will check out the hotels that surrounded the area. We would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Blend of Convenience, Whimsy and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: tdpndc
Reviews.Content: The Inner Harbor location is one of the best. Very close to everything. The lobby and rooms are trendy but not outrageous. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable -- and most rooms offer a view of the harbor. Staff is very friendly and helpful. It has a few very minor problems but none as serious as others have made them sound.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Pier 5”
Reviews.Author: joevanney
Reviews.Content: Paid $75 through Priceline. Room showed a little wear, but we had a nice view of the harbor and the hotel location is great. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ObservantGuest
Reviews.Content: We chose this place for the night after we got married. The website reservation form said "Harbor View." In our room, a brick wall faced the harbor, and our window faced other rooms! We asked to change rooms and they said they would get back to us, but never did. The heater was a cheap electric room unit: noisy but still left the room cold. The bathroom was like something out of a cheap $29 motel. They also tried to tack on a bogus $5 "connectivity fee" that was never listed in the internet price. The only positives were the full box of Godiva chocolates, and a good breakfast, but those didn't justify the extremely high price. If you want to be on the Inner Harbor, try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway and very dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pier 5 along with our dog and had a wonderful time. The staff were quite friendly and helpful. Although we were overcharged by $100, this was easily resolved at check-out. The room was very comfortable and spacious. The room also had a nice large bathroom and a sweet balcony to sit and sip our free bloody marys on Sunday morning. We look forward to going back for another weekend escape...so does our dog.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs a lot of work.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Not what I expected for hotel in that location. Bell hop made me a little nervous because she was hovering over my luggage even while I was checking in. She waited for me to be checked in, which took a long time. Took me a while to check in because only one person was working the front desk. Room was okay, same thing you will find in a Motel 6 in the middle of nowhere. No wash cloths in the room. Comforter, which was a bit old, smelled of a distinct cologne but I was too tired to complain but the thought of someone lying on that bed just before I came in bothered me. That connectivity charge was not necessary. Can't even charge to my room from the restaurant where I had breakfast. Had to go up to my room to grab my credit card. Air conditioning unit was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sweetie and I stayed at this hotel after finding a deal on the Internet. When we walked in, we thoght the decor was a bit gaudy, but hey, we can be flexible. The one positive thing I can say is that a couplel of the staff members were very nice. Not nice enough to make up for a shoddy hotel, but it's important to acknowledge the positive. And now to acknowledge the negative . . . How about they lost our reservation? And instead of resolving the matter, they had US get on the phone and speak with the booking agent. After finally being found, our room was not ready until after 4 pm. Ridiculous! Once we arrived in the room, I attempted to turn on the TV. Before I could turn it on however, the heavy sliding door on the TV chest FELL ON ME. Upon closer inspection, it was obvious why it fell on me . . . there was no hinge. This was a completely reckless, foreseeable thing, and the injury that I sustained was entirely avoidable had the hotel bothered to make sure that the room was habitable before releasing it. To top off a horrible stay: the front desk staff said it was fine for us to check-out an hour late because our room was not ready on time. Apparently this was not communicated to the cleaning woman, who barged into our room and asked when we would be leaving b/c she needed to clean up. Yes, ladies and gentlemen, our room turned into a 3-ring circus as I tried to explain to the woman that the appropriate thing to do would be to call rather than barge in. Luckily, we were in the process of packing up, but what if I had been coming out of the shower? I filed an incident report with the hotel, and even then have not heard from a manager. It is a shame that some establishments will only improve their services based on legal action taken by customers. BOTTOM LINE: don't stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Pier 5 Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 711 Eastern Ave, Baltimore, MD 21202
